text: I have stayed in Phoenix only six nights in my life, but all six of those nights I got wasted at Tim Finnegan's.  A+ would recommend.

Relative to its location, this bar is a little gem. It's tough to find non-chain anything in Phoenix, let alone something with good food, but this place serves some sort of Irish bread (soda bread?), made in-house, with a very dense consistency and delicious flavor. 

There's an authentic-ish looking wooden bar area, live music (when I visited on a Monday night at least), bartenders were social enough, and they had some decent drink prices as well. Horribly weak first drink unfortunately, but not enough to keep me from coming back two nights later while I was still in town for work.

Check it out!

Tim Finnegan's is outstanding! It is the most authentic Irish Pub in the valley, and in Arizona for that matter. It is operated and still somewhat based out of Ireland, by actually Irish, people. It has an authentic pub feel and ambiance, and is not overwhelmed with the color green, leprechauns, shamrocks and all that stereotypical, superficial and over romanticized "Irish stuff" that you find in most "Irish pubs" in the states. In fact, I've never seen any of these things here. If you're looking for a more ambient pub experience (which I like) I would go anytime time between opening and 7pm. After that it'll get a little more loud as any place selling tippling beverages would.

The food is fantastic. I've tried a plethora of things from their cod sliders, flat breads (it's essentially pizza) burgers, fish and chips, Shepherd's Pie and many others. I have not been disappointed with anything here. Their drink selection is what you will find in any Hibernian pub, and they poor the best pint of Guinness (properly poured, clean lines, and ACTUALLY in a Guinness glass) I have found out of the many pubs in the phoenix area.  They offer wide range of Draught Irish beers, and have rotating tap of local  & nationwide craft breweries, as well as an extensive bar with a plethora of Irish and Scottish Whiskies. They even serve Kilkenny Cream Ale, which is hard to find in most places around the states. I would suppose the only downside on the food is their dessert. It is very tasty, however a bit expensive for the portion size. I got the Guinness Brownie (or cake, can't remember), with ice cream and it was very delicious! However, it was small and $8, which is costly for a poor(ish) college student like me haha. 

Overall this place is a great, fun, budget friendly (but quality) place, with fun events such as trivia and kareokee (however you spell that), live bands, and amazing happy hour deals, like half off apps which are fantastically portioned and taste great, dollar off drafts, and $3 wells, EVERYDAY from 4-7pm and 10-2am. The service is usually great, and sometimes it's slow for your server to come, but it is entirely understandable because I know they get busy. I would recommend it to anyone who is look for an authentic Irish pub, or just in the mood for something different. Tim Finnegan's will always have mine and my friends business, and highly recommend your patronage as well!

When I am craving really awesome fish and chips, this is the place to go. Especially on fridays, where their fish and chips is all you can eat! Although, be warned that the fish and chips servings are huge so come super hungry lol. And Fridays, they have some live music adding to the awesome vibe of the place. It's an awesome cool place to have a drink and get my fish and chippies on :)

Very good. The draft cider was great, as well as the Thursday special (a 5 oz. flat iron steak). Our server, Cheryl was very nice and helpful. The fish an chips were average, but the garlic chips were pleasantly good. Overall happy with the experience, I guess I need to learn the enjoy Irish food more!. We will be back again for sure.

Nice casual Irish pub with awesome food. Thursday nights they have this 2 man band that's I have seen at other spots in the Phoenix area and them alone is worth the trip here. The outside before u walk in looks a little sketchy but once u walk in the doors, you feel like ur in an Irish pub.

This is our favorite hang out! Usually bar food isn't the greatest tasting but I would go here just for the food. It is amazing! Try the garlic fries, they are to die for! They usually have live music playing which makes for good entertainment.

Great pub where the food is not at all an afterthought. On the first visit, we took advantage of the check-in deal and got the mussels with the shepherd's pie and fish and chips. All were outstanding. The bartender also offered some sauce that complemented the shepherd's pie which was a thoughtful gesture. The thing I loved about the pie was that it wasn't covered in cheese and that everything was well balanced. My husband got the fish and chips and gave me a bite but wasn't all that open to sharing, so I'll have to order my own next time. 

The second time we went we took advantage of the happy hour special and got a bunch of apps including the mussels again, crab cakes, wings, and cod sliders. I really enjoyed the cod sliders. The bread was light and crunchy, the cole slaw topping was fresh and the fish was perfectly battered. Such a great combo. The crab cakes were really fresh and the wasabi sauce was a nice compliment. The wings were good- as you'd expect for pub fare. The mussels again were yummy with the spicy broth perfect to dip the homemade bread in. We found out they'll sell the bread by the loaf, so I'll have to do that for a special occasion.

We absolutely love it here! Yes the drinks are great, and the food is wonderful, but it's the SERVICE that keeps us coming back. Seana, Bobby, and Kristen are without a doubt 100% of the reason we continue to spend our money here as apposed to the many available bar options in the area. Our drinks come out in a timely manner and we never reach the bottom of our drinks before we are offered another. We look forward to coming to a bar where everyone knows our name and remembers our food and drink preferences.

Bleu Cheese Burger and In House Fresh Cut fries! Hands down the best Burger/Fry combo I have had in Phoenix!!! 
Great bartender! Service with a smile! Definitely a great local pub I will be revisiting quite a bit!!!

if you're looking for an authentic irish pub, this is it. this looks like it was brought over from ireland. the bar is really nice and the entire place is cool. they also have a live band during happy hour! that's a big plus for me to beable to listen to a band before 5.  during happy hour, which they have 7 days a week, all appetizers are half off. they have lots of good appetizers. if you order off the menu besides appetizers, the food is very good. the corned beef and cabbage is great with huge portions. i've been here multiple times and all the portions are large, great flavor, and it's a big plus to get the appetizers half off. there are plenty of plasmas in the dining area and bar to catch a game. they also have a band on friday nights. not sure about saturday. i think as far as atmosphere, it's very cool and you feel like you're in ireland.
Its my home away from home. Love the bartenders and all the other regulars. Last nights open bar/costume party was awesome!

My favorite place for fish fry. They perfectly pour pints of Guinness, too.

The ginormous chunks of cod with a crispy, light-to-medium batter is very tasty. I prefer it with the scalloped potatoes but you don't get a choice during Friday all-you-can-eat.

It's a small-to-medium sized pub with a nice scotch and whiskey menu. I had my first Tullamore Dew here and it didn't disappoint. It's a bit dark and some of the tables are wine barrels - makes comfortable sitting a bit of a challenge. The live bands I've heard were great and can be pretty loud. A couple of TVs dot the bar with all things football (soccer) and American football (if you're a Jets fan).

Service is friendly and only a couple of times it wasn't very prompt.

It definitely has a bit of character to it and I wish I had more time to stop by there.

Great service, decent Irish grub that makes you want to drink more Guinness, authentic pub atmosphere and live music certain nights.  

The Shepherd's Pie ($12.99) that is so proudly highlighted in the menu missed the mark.  Having lived in London, we're a big fan of the dish and were excited to see that TF uses the more traditional minced lamb and not beef.  However, the meat was overpowered by way too much dried rosemary leaves.  The brown bread that accompanied it was the highlight, followed by the mashed potatoes and finally the lamb.

This is a good place to hang out over a couple of pints while the food comes second.

Wonderful little spot off the 17.. It seems family friendly--there was a mom & dad with a baby and toddler having dinner and the baby was sleeping but the toddler was dancing to the live music. Plus I heard the dad speak with an Irish brogue giving an air of authenticity of the "Irish' in the restaurants name.  My husband had the fish & chips and the fish was delicious but the  fries were soggy so that  saved calories for Guinness Chocolate cake& ice cream :). He also had a pint of Guinness (or two). Forgot how creamy and rich that stuff tasted.  I had the baked fish and it was wonderful but next time I'd ask them to hold the gravy. We're planning an after -work party here. We'll be back. LOVE the live music!!
Service was good, but the food was not. Mashed potatoes were bland, Ruben was not tangy enough, bread pudding was burnt.  I obsess over bread pudding and so I left sad.
I have always loved coming here. They recently changes their food menu and it's a great selection of Irish favorites.

Tim's has a a nice vibe and is a pretty good Irish restaurant and pub. I went with a few friends one Saturday early evening and the place was maybe a 1/4th full, but by the time we left, it was filling up. We started with the pretzel bites to share and thanks to a yelp check in, it was complimentary. One of my friends tried to order a beer from the list but that was out. He ordered a burger with bacon and no onions and it came with no bacon and onions. Unfortunately we didn't see the server for a while and we made do with what we had. I had the Killarney chicken which I thought was good and flavorful. The chicken was tender and moist. Our other friend had burger and he said it was good. I was pleased with my entree but I only gave Tim's 3 out of 5 because of the food mix up, no check in with us to see how things were, and also when the bill came they forgot to take off the appetizer. I'm happy to give it another try as it has a relaxing, pub vibe.

Love the garlic chips. Every time my bf and I have gone its been dead...which I like. Not too loud and only a couple of patrons. Dirty girl scout is the best drink. Will continue to go back. Check the website for deals and specials...otherwise its too pricey.

You're out in the north central valley, you don't really want to go to a dive bar, you're not a hipster and you can't spend another trendy moment eating anything on a board.... pull up a stool at Tim Finnegans for a pint and wait for the music or an interesting conversation to begin! It's better than anything in the Metrocenter area has any right to be (in its current incarnation at least).

Food was good, but service sucked.. We got a waitress that gave us attitude the whole time and when we asked for things it took her 10 to 15 mins to go and get it, it WAS NOT BUSY! Everyone in my party (8) people we all got our food at different times.. One person was does eating while the last person just got their food.. Great happy hour deal.. Just bad service. I won't go back if It was up to me...

I was dubious of the food after the last menu change, and also the mediocre transition period, but the kinks have been worked out (for pub grub). Just don't order off the reuben menu -- they couldn't make an edible reuben to save their life. And I've tried three reubens. They were all lukewarm, tough/chewy, and flavorless.

I miss the Irish sausages, but the shepherd's pie is still a great choice. They've tweaked the recipe a bit since the last time I was here, but it's still wonderful. And the curry fries as well as the corned beef & cabbage taquito oddities are also good choices. I've also had the fish and chips, which are great most of the time with one or two exceptions (oil wasn't hot enough/too cold/etc.). The peppercorn burger is also worth it.

The bar's atmosphere is what seal's the deal for me, though. Having spent some time in Ireland, it's pretty much the most authentic thing you're going to find in Phoenix. And the bartender's are always friendly. On weekends it's now rather busy, but still worth it. If you see me here during a weekday afternoon however, noshing on some curry fries, feel free to join me.

If you're in the area, definitely stop by for a few pints.

Great Irish Bar. If you need pictures of Ireland or Irish flags to let you know you're in an Irish bar, this isn't the place for you. It's dark and cozy and simple. You know you're in an Irish bar because it feels like one, it doesn't have to tell you. Best Irish bar in the valley.
So much fun here! The food is great and bartender Dan is awesome!! Will be coming back for sure!!

Tim Finnegans when will you open a location in Tucson? Every time I go to Phoenix I try to stop by this great Irish pub. A ton of great beers on tap and fabulous ambiance, this pub is a great place to spend a few hours. I especially love the food. This is the place for Shepherd's Pie. If you've never had it, Shepherd's Pie is ground lamb, veggies and mashed potatoes. It is amazing! I also love the cod sliders. Tim Finnegans has happy hour specials and bands on Fridays and Saturdays. If you're in the area and have a hankering for all things Irish stop by!

We stopped in for appetizers. Although we had a great waiter, our starters were so-so. We tried the much tauted corned beef /cabbage taquitos, but were not impressed at all.  The spinach/artichoke dip with homemade pita chips were good, so would go with those again. Since we weren't wowed with the appetizers, we didn't stay for dinner.

This is a very quaint clean bar/restaurant!  Went to the all you can eat fish n chips on Friday night and I must say this is truly English fish the batter is exactly the same you will find in England.  The cod was very very good n tasty!! Cant wait to return! Oh and the waitress are very very friendly and welcome your business!!

This place is one of my favorite local spots. The corned beef taquitos and the cod with chorizo are some of my favorite things on the menu.  They also have a large selection of hard to find Irish whiskeys and single malt scotch. My wife does not share my love of this place, as she likes wine and salad, neither of which are great here, but hey, its an Irish pub and I don't think I'd want to hang out at any that were known for wine and salad.

Great service and atmosphere. My girlfriend and I ordered the spinach artichoke dip for an appetizer and fish and chips for entree....more than pleased! Definitely coming back and also interested in experiencing a night out there too!
A great new local pub. Atmosphere was fun and the staff worked very hard to deliver a memorable experience. I will be back again soon.

I will never go there again.  We were brought our drinks and that was all we got.  We were looking forward to the fish and chips.  The waitress totally ignored us.  Unless you are a regular or buying booze you are invisible to them.  Everyone that came In after us had not only their drinks ordered but there food ordered   Service sucked worse than a vampire sucking blood from you, probably would be a better experience.

Ive been here several times and the food is always great. I always get the Reuben because it really is incredibly delicious. The reason for giving only three stars is the service.  Every time I have eaten here the food, the check, and drink refills took a really long time and this even happened when there were only about five customers in there. The waitresses would rarely come to the table and were hard to flag down because we hardly even saw them waking around. The food is worth it though.

Great Irish pub in the desert!  The owner's an Irishman who moved here from the Bronx, and NY Irish are more Irish today than Dublin Irish.  

The food, both Irish and American cuisine, are great.  I love my Irish grub, but incredible burgers are there to be had!  Just the way you like them; not 165 degree in the middle hockey pucks you get most places.

Can't get there enough to please me and in football season, Tommy's Irish comes out and it's a NY Jet Fan's hangout, where new friends are made every week and old friendships revived and rejuvenated.

Give me Tim Finn's any day of the week!!!  HOME AGAIN IS THE FEELING!
Loved it....especially the Bailey's Bread Pudding, a must have!

We just had dinner here tonight and the food was exceptional especially for a pub. Since it was Sunday, all appetizers were half off and we decided since it was our first time here we would focus on trying a few of these to see if we liked the food. We ordered several items (lamb skewers, short rib sliders, sausage rolls, corned beef taquitos, fries (garlic and curry dipping sauces), hot wings, and crab cakes. Everything we ate was extremely good. I asked our server if the food was prepared on site and she told us everything is made from scratch every morning. I highly recommend the sausage rolls especially if you have never had them as they were delicious. The lamb skewers were good and the mint yogurt sauce provides a nice contrast to the somewhat salty lamb. My least favorite of the appetizers was the taquitos but this is just personal preference. Our service was fantastic all night long. We are definitely looking forward to coming back.

Walked in at 6:45 on a Tuesday. Sat at the bar. Service slower than molasses and not sequenced to arrival.  The bar is large and U shaped so the back bar in the center obscures the visibility of customers on the other side to where the lone bartender is working - not a good set up for a single bartender.

Apparently don't know how to make a Bloody Mary - it was overly spiced and salted - basically inpalatable.  Happy hour prices don't apply to most of their mixed drinks even if made with well liquor.

You cannot get a second chance of a first impression - regulars seemed to be better taken care of than newcomers 

Won't be back.

This is definitely one of my top 5 favorite spots in Phoenix. It has a dark, pub-style feel throughout; but very clean and cozy atmosphere. A majority of the time, you can seat yourself wherever you like. The staff is friendly, fast, and helpful without being overbearing or annoying. 
 I've visited 5+ times and never had a bad experience. During happy hour, appetizers are half price. You can easily get full for $10. The corned beef and cabbage dinner is excellent, as are the appetizers of crab cakes and garlic aoili fries. 
All in all, I thoroughly enjoy this place and highly recommend it!
THE best Irish pub I've found in the valley, great staff, food and drinks. I just wish it wasn't in such a crappy area.

Five stars for sure! Went for the first time the other night. Live, authentic Irish band playing . Got there in time to try the cod sliders off the happy hour menu.  Came with 3 for only a few bucks ($5?). It's a cozy bar but the food presentation is better than you would expect. Also had the soft pretzels, they were a little too hard on the outside don't recommend those. But I can't wait to go try some more menu options. Bartender was pleasant , patio clean .

I am sitting in Tim Finnegan's on a Saturday afternoon, having finished a tasty late lunch while waiting for my husband to finish playing golf. The decor of this place is classic local pub, and I've patronized many in the U.K. and other places in the world with which to compare it. The bartender was friendly, helping me choose from the menu a light meal that was delicious. I had the Chicken Wrap, and was able to substitute a cup of soup instead of fries. The IPA that was on tap, Dogfish Head, had just enough bitterness to keep this hop-head happy.

love the San Tan beer! The lamb pasty was very good. The time of my visit the bar was empty and it was just my Mom and me. We each ordered a beer and an entree. I had a yelp check in which included a free appetizer. However, when I tried to redeem it for the Artichoke dip I was told it was happy hour so the coupon didn't count. Say what? there were no restrictions on the check-in coupon. Anyway, we paid the bill and left. All over? I'll be back for the Women's FIFA on Sunday. Everyone deserves a second chance!

This is the best Irish pub in AZ. They pour a proper pint, fantastic chips, the garlic and curry sauces and delicious, the fish is crispy and moist, and the service is spot on. Oh yeah, the beef burger was tasty!

Cannot think of one reason why we would return.  Service was very slow and we would cut that some slack if the food was any good but that was not the case our appetizer arrived with our meal. The food was virtually tasteless.  I had the Margarita bread my husband had the turkey  club which was nothing to write home about and the fries were cold.  All around the experience was very disappointing.

They added too much to their menu, and they're overwhelmed. They also got rid of their good lunch specials. So, go here for the drinks and the atmosphere.

Hopefully the management is only doing this temporarily. Because I miss their $5 lunch specials. They're not so popular yet as to scrape those, add a dozen items to the menu, and call it quits. Their kitchen can't handle it.

So, eat beforehand and come up. The drinks are still good, until they raise the prices of those too.

Edit: Spoke too soon. I just went to their website and noticed they changed their "$3 Smithwicks Every day All Day" to the far inferior Carlsberg for $3 whatever, whatever. Oh, it's sad to see such potential beginning to tank so soon. Service has dropped, quality of food has dropped, and now they really are already raising their drink prices. Shame.

Best Fish and Chips in the valley!!!! Great food specials every day of the week. Live bands on Friday. From the food to the decor this place just feels like home. Good Craic as the Irish say. Guinness poured the way it should be and a very friendly and knowledgeable staff to guide you through a truly wonderful Irish pub experience. They also have a sister pub downtown that features the same great service and a similar menu!!! Try the deconstructed old fashioned specialty cocktail, it's the bees knees!
Nice place to hang out with friends and have a few drinks but food isn't that good and the wait staff are indifferent.

Loved it. Loved every aspect of my visit here, from the decor, lighting and tables to the atmosphere, music and especially the food and service! To begin with, Finnegan's is an actual Irish-owned pub, and this place lays claim to the Guinness Perfect Pint challenge crown holder. I don't remember the bartender's name, but regardless, every pint I had was beautiful and tasted spectacular and certainly lived up to the promise of enjoying a perfect pint. However not everyone is looking for the perfect pint, I wasn't, but I'm happy to have found it. 

I digress. We came in for their food and again, I wasn't disappointed. Our server Shawn was prompt in greeting us, clean cut (as in didn't have any noticable body odor and was wearing an awesome Guinness soccer jersey!), and spoke in a friendly manner. He took the time to explain the beers on tap, their characteristics and what to expect when drinking them. He even had the bartender, Seana (easy to remember these two characters, basically the same name and they were having fun with everyone in the pub), give us a sample of two beers on tap to see if we liked them! We enjoyed them, but since they have Guinness on tap, well...moving on. 

Looking at their short, but comprehensive menu I noticed lots of things I wanted to try, but couldn't decide what to eat. Enter our server Shawn. I asked what he likes on the menu and, of course, he said it's easier to say what he doesn't care for, and without missing a beat he led me to their signature dinner plates and recommended the Pan Seared Cod. Of course he also mentioned the Shepherd's Pie, Killarney Chicken and something else I've forgotten. Regardless, I ended up getting the pan seared cod while my wife got the Rasher cheeseburger and our friend ordered a pretzel basket and hot wings. We took turns sampling each other's food and there was never a hint of disappointment from anyone and their orders. Even when we wanted to split the check 3 ways (business cards from each of us), Shawn didn't bat an eye, he simply said "No problem, guys." It mustn't have been a problem, he was back in less than a minute with three separate checks! 

Long story short: Amazing food, fantastic pints, and exceptionally fun service from Shawn and Seana! We will definitely be back here and I hope to try many more items on their menu to add to this review later!
Kim and i say thanks to Harrison for his twig and berries drink and his velvet hammer drink. Come check this place out!!! Great good, great drinks, great service!!!!!

Tim Finnegan's is a great place to have some food and a few drinks. The food is great and the staff is very friendly and attentive. The owner is a real nice guy and actually from Dublin so it is a real Irish pub! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to have a fun and relaxing time.

Best Irish fare in Phoenix !

The only REAL Shepherd's Pie in Phoenix made with lamb, not ground beef, which is the most savory pie I have ever had.  It has ruined me for all all others.  Throw in a pint of Magner's Cider and don't forget the bread pudding!

The food alone is worth the trip here!
One of the best Irish pubs in AZ. LOVE that they offer Irish music, Irish flood,  and the staff are very friendly and welcoming. Live music is great. Can't wait to come back.

My husband & I stopped in for the pub quiz & happy hour. We will definitely be back! Fun quiz, great staff (our waitress was Patience- quick service, friendly), & great food. We tried the corned beef & cabbage taquitos (interesting), garlic aioli fries (the aioli is delicious- could put that on everything), & the cod sliders (yummy) from the appetizer menu. For dinner we had the Reuben (great) & the Wasabi Caesar Salad- that was one of the best salads we've ever had.
This is definitely a place I hope to visit on our next trip to Phoenix!

Six months ago I would have given Finnegans 4 stars, but lately the service and worse the musical acts have gone downhill. They used to have a great act Shay Veno & Jane Hilton playing every Thursday night. It was nice getting to see some good live music on a weekday.
 They used to have mostly Irish inspired acts on the weekends, but now it seems to be all 80's and 90's cover bands. They have taken a lot of Irish out of what was my favorite Irish Pub.
 The food is good, but the service leaves a bit too be desired. The drinks are always good and the bartenders are talented and the women seem to like them quite a bit.

I hope their Irish food is better than on St Patty's Day!  Corned beef tasted like it came out of a can. Waited so long for silverware that potatoes were cold. Service was terrible! First waiter was completely drunk and spilling food. I understand they are busy, but unbelievably poor service!
Great Pub atmosphere... $5 Burgers on Monday....Happy hour great deals and Owner present quite a bit-- Love the potato skins!!

We don't have that.
No, we don't have that.
We just ran out of that.
We ran out of that.

Dinky sausage rolls. Needs more pastry on the outside.
I've had better sausage rolls frozen from Tesco's.
Wings were good but I was hoping for a dozen and not 10, and they needed to be crispier.
Order the wings WET.
I spied things on other people's plates and they looked OK.
Other things I'd like to try are the fish n chips and curry fries.
Great interior of the place though, it's everything I would want, and the service is mindful and nice. 
BUT..... remember there's only one pen in the entire bar and your table will have to share it when the checks come. 
Because...... they don't have that.

So we made the place listen to "Orgasmatron" by Motorhead thanks to my friend's jukebox app.

UP THE IRONS!

I've been making trips to Tim Finnegans before I lived in Arizona.  On a past visit my friend brought me here.  It was a place me made trips to for the shepherds pie.  I had my first pie here and have now tried it many other places.  Tim Finnegans offers up the best and it's made with lamb (as opposed to beef in many places).  Always was it down with a pint of Strongbow or Magners.

It's a good bar for sports too.  There's always a soccer or football game on.  Man City swag is plentiful here.

Service is a bit slow from time to time but I can live with that.

6 stars would be more appropriate for this Gem of a restaurant.Jimmy the owner is all about his customers, the food is beyond great, the service was with Anthony was excellent. They are very personable. I could go on and on about our New Place. Waiting on our incredible Bread Pudding.We will be back more and more. Jimmy, keep up this great service and great food, Tom amd Jennifer

I tried this place a few weeks back and have been meaning to get to the review.

I couldn't manage to get anyone to go out and have a few pints with me, but you know what? I have no problem drinking alone so I went anyhow.

The place is pretty large for the cozy pub feel that it has. The music was great, though I agree the soud system needs some work. It is hard to hear from the actual bar, though maybe this is on purpose. 

They have a good sized patio for us smokers and you are allowed to take your drinks with you. Thank god.

They claim the only real shepphards pie in Arizona, so I had to try it and it was fantastic, though the real star was the brown bread they served with it. They bake it fresh on site and it is amazingly good.

Most of the wait staff had Irish accents. How can you not enjoy the charm in an Irishman serving you a beer. The owner was even making rounds introducing himself and he was a standup guy.

I haven't made it back yet but it is definately in the stars.

I'm a Los Angeles native that comes out to Phoenix a lot to visit my sisters. This place is a must on every trip out here. 

Great bartenders, food and service.  There's not many places in the Metro Phoenix area to go to, but this is it. A must for anyone anywhere near Peoria and the 17 fwy.

First time at Tim's was (supposed to be for) Happy Hour.  

There was actually nothing wrong with the faire at Tim's - the problem was the pricing.  

Our bill was $60.  We had four appetizers, three cocktails, and two sodas.  We had garlic fries (A+), sausage rolls (B-), baby back sliders (B) and chicken strips (A) that were all on the happy hour menus -- supposed to be half off during happy hour.  We also had 2 margaritas, a bourbon [house] and seven, and two cokes.  

Still trying to figure out how the math worked on that one, but since it was my birthday we weren't going to argue (we were just going to hurry out and go up the street to Black Angus, where six cocktails [4 margs and two bourbon and cokes) and three apps (nachos, tater skins and pretzel cheese sticks) were $30-something dollars.  

Though the food was good at Tim's - the items are too pricey for that neighborhood.  

Decor is very cute and clean - waitress was mostly attentive (only had to ask twice for a couple of items).  ALSO Big A+ because RUSH was playing on the muzac for what seemed an entire album side (good choice).

Great bar but should have not gone the day after St Patrick's Day as the menu was limited to about 3 entrees- 3 people in the group got the fish and chips which were pretty good. The fish was placed on top of the fries which made them a bit soggy. The service was excellent but one of the guests in our party said the men's bathroom was disgusting. Perhaps we will try again when it's not near an Irish day.

I am a fan because this place is right around the corner from my place... sooooo that is fantastic.
The food is alright, nothing exciting
Lots of good beer on tap, and some really awful beer on tap.
Check it out!
I like it. :)

I am the Duke of O'Connors pub, but I love Tim Finnegan's too.

I go there to drink, I come here to eat.  The hot wings are nothing short of awesome, I have them at least once a week.  Oh, and the Cod and Chorizo is awesome, It is my favorite fish dish in Phoenix.  Shepard's pie is made with lamb, like it should be!  Corned Beef and Cabbage is also really good, not as good as my Mom's but close.

The bartenders (usually Tommy and /or Jimmy) and wait staff take good care of their customers, especially their regulars.

When they have live music it is usually pretty good, but the week night people have been so so as of late.  Not my thing, but they do draw somewhat of a crowd.  Weekends are much better.  Come to see any of  the Irish Bands, or Carvin Jones.

Trivia on Tuesdays is awesome, it is run by Cedar the Duke of this place.
Look for Team Beef and Titties!

I absolutely LOVE this place. They have such a wonderful staff of servers and bartenders. They are super personable and friendly. The drinks are stiff, and the food is great. 
My favorite is the Chicken and Red Pepper Flatbread, which is half priced on Wednesdays. But worth full price any day of the week... so try it!

I am elated that this authentic Irish Pub opened up in my neibhorhood. I had the Ruben for lunch and it was the best I've  ever had, the french fries were delicious as well, my server Melissa made me feel like I was at home. I loved it so much that I had to bring my son back for dinner.  I was still full from lunch, but that didn't stop me from eating the corn beef and cabbage taquitos that were smothered in homemade green sauce recommended by Dave... delicious! Alex and Tommy came over and introduced themselves to us it felt like we were with old friends. These guys are stuck with me.
Great dive bar, and they have karaoke on Sunday nights! A great place to come after work for a beer. The service is always quick and the music is good, too. It's never packed, but the music is loud.
Great beer selections, authentic Irish food and friendly wait staff, highly recommended!

A friend and I saw this restaurant featured on PBS Check Please and so we decided to check it out. We ordered the potato skins, the large cod plate (which we split) and a small dinner salad. The cod batter was light and not at all greasy. The food is bar food, but fresh. The atmosphere is what you could expect at an Irish pub. No news channels on TVs (thank goodness). The service was very good. We both said we would like to go there again.

They just updated their menu and it's good! They have a better variety of entrees now and all the new ones I've tried are pretty darn good. They also swapped out Strong Bow for Magner's Irish Cider and the Stella for Guinness 250 which is awesome.

This place was good. I had the fish and chips and it was huge portion. Also had the pastie and it was great with the onion gravy. The decor is good and the service was great. Smith wicks on tap is essential and they had it so they pass the

We went there for dinner on a Friday night. The place has some people, but it wasn't super crowded. We sat down and ordered food. The food took forever to come out and was cold when we got it. The Reuben was 99% coleslaw. Very little meat. My boyfriend ordered their chicken strips, and he received three instead of the four the bartender said he would. The food sucked. The bartender however was very sweet. We tipped her because we didn't feel like she should suffer for something that wasn't her fault.

When I came across this place I was like hhmmnn Irish pub beer, food, and a brawl? 1st Impression Pretty plain looking from the outside, nice and clean they have a smokers patio as well. Before you step inside you can hear the live music playing. Step in and to my surprise its more of a family sit down restaurant that a drunken pub. Self seating the server came over right away and was quite pleasant. 
      The menu has a list of foods that from what I know to be "Irish" foods some that are not but have an "Irish" twist. Me and my date agree to 2 different appetizers, the Artichoke and spinach dip with pub made pita chips. The second was something that less traditional the Corned beef and cabbage "taquitos" The dip didn't stand a chance we destroyed it! The taquitos however were not at all what I expected. I was expecting the corned beef to be in a more "solid" state however it seemed more as if it was minced with the cabbage Strange texture and not very flavorful The green sauce was fairly tasty and my lovely date enjoyed the horseradish/ sour cream topping.
       Moving on the the entrees I chose the Real lamb shepherds pie, and my date selected the Icelandic Cod. The Pie seems like a small portion until I began eating, the serving container is very deep and half way though my meal is was wondering how so much food could be hiding in there. It had a very familiar flavor that I still cant place my finger on. It was very fulfilling I enjoyed it and would order it again. My dates Cod looked and smelled amazing! She said the seasoned mashed potatoes were very tasty and so was the fish was really fresh and cooked just right, and could easily be a go to dish after trying out some more of the menu. To top of our dinning we gave the Irish bread pudding a try. It was a more solid bread pudding not all mushy, not over soaked. It does have some Baily's Irish cream liquor. in it the last bite I found a shot of it lol
      Over we were both very pleased with our experience and look forward to going again soon to try some thing else. However the future with not include a re-up on the taquitos =P
Great place! Definitely a hidden gem. Awesome food. Lots of drink specials. Everything on the menu is good.
Fish fry was good but pricey. Chicken was good and fries are good too good happy hour and our waitress Morgan was great thank you first time here.

Every time I come to Arizona I visit here, great beer, great atmosphere and the service is always awesome. 

Special mention to the curry chips because they're beautiful, the other food items are really good too.

I'm in love.  This place was amazing, and I wish I lived in Phoenix so I could come here more often.  I was here on a Monday night with some friends, and Monday just happens to be $5 burger night.  And these are some amazing burgers...good enough to pay full price, but what a steal at $5 a piece.  We all had the burger with the onion-bacon marmalade and garlic aioli.  I have no idea what onion-bacon marmalade is or how one goes about making it, but it was one of the best toppings I've ever had on a burger.  The beef was very flavorful and while I ordered my burger medium, it was slightly overcooked, but still good.  Brioche buns topped them off, and they were very tasty as well.  The fries were nice and crispy, and a perfect compliment to the burgers.  Nice selection of beers on tap and in bottles, and a few specialty drinks in addition to the full bar.  There were also a few musicians taking turns performing, and they were very nice to listen to.  Not sure if this a regular Monday occurance or not, but I enjoyed the music.  It wasn't too loud either...we still have conversations without shouting while the artists were performing.  Great pub!
Get there for happy hour.  The food is excellent and the prices can't be beat!  I ordered the blue cheese burger and onion soup awesome.

Enjoying my favorite beer deschutes fresh squeezed and the dbacks game. Great environment and Sam has been an excellent server. Had the chorizo potato soup and it was amazing. Everyone should check this place out.
Great place!  Bartender was nice.  I live in Dallas and we were just trying to find a place to have a beer.  I will go back next time I'm in Phoenix.
Awesome place! Great service! Great atmosphere. Bartender, Dan, makes a great Bloody Mary. The cod sliders were fantastic with a spicy tarter and coleslaw...yum! Highly recommend

Found this gem of a restaurant on New Years Day. Service (Dan!!) was friendly and fast. We asked him about the menu, what's good, etc and based his recommendation we ordered Fish n Chips, Shepard's Pie and Killarney Chicken. The portions were generous and the food delicious. So we had to end with the bread pudding. One piece with three spoons. Gone in a flash bcs it was sooo good. 

Booth seating, high tops and bar. Lots of TVs but not too loud. Can't wait to go back!

I have been craving fish and chips for the longest time!!!  I met up recently with an old friend of mine after the death of her sister, my best friend from high school.  We wanted to visit and toast her.  Tim Finnegan's fit the bill!

I admire these guys for not abandoning an area that has seen better days.  They are on the southern side of Metrocenter, south of Castles and Coasters.

We got settled in and began reminiscing about my friend.  The place was nearly empty at lunch time on a weekday but our waitress was really friendly and helpful.  We both ordered the fish and chips...;.OMG, they were heavenly!!

The place is not very big but they do have an area for live music.  I will be going back and turning friends on to it.

I will always support a place that is staying true to the community and met some really nice folks there.  I'm looking forward to seeing some live music there and having some corned beef and some more of those delectible fish and chips!!!

Drove by and popped in for a couple of beers, a burger and the app sampler. Wow! The burger was soooo good, and the fries were DIVINE! Everything on the app platter was good, and the beer was cold and delicious. I will def be back!

My husband and I went here today for the Manchester City game and it was awesome! Our server Nicole was great! We were bummed more of the City supporters weren't there. The Chicken Curry soup they made was AMAZING! Loved the fish and chips and my husband got the Turkey burger with green beans. Insane food! We can't wait to come back!!

Corned beef and cabbage taquitos...sounds crazy, so I had to try it...it was GREAT!  The $3 dollar Carlsberg big draft beers were also GREAT!  The bartender was GREAT as well!  If those 3 reasons aren't good enough to try out Tim Finnegans, then go because I said so :)

One of the only places in the Valley where an Irish breakfast can be had.

Went to this homely establishment this afternoon (Saturday) for lunch with my father and it was pretty empty, not too surprising for the area and the time of day but quite frankly, that appealed to me.

The waitress was very friendly and prompt in making sure to take our drink order.  Given the number of other patrons (maybe 5, two of which were sitting at the bar) it took a bit longer than I would have thought for her to come back, but as my dad and I were in no hurry and the game was on the TV.  She was very good about giving my dad information regarding menu items and portion sizes.

I ordered the Irish breakfast with a Jameson and ginger and my dad ordered the dinner portion fish and chips.  The breakfast came with eggs, brown bread, beans, sausage, and grilled tomato.  Everything was amazing, generous portions and tasty.

The fish and chips was a slab of cod and a heap of fries and cole slaw.  The fish was pretty good and the few fries I managed to steal were great.  My dad raved about it and he's pretty particular about fish.

Great pour on the Jameson and Ginger from the bar.  I'm curious if there was any ginger in it at all... but I'm not one to complain :)

We both were members of the clean plate club and very satisfied.  I'll definitely be back again soon!

Great place!! we will be back, order the Flat Iron steak over the prime rib! 
Next time I will have the Shepherd's Pie.

We were delighted to learn that TF has re-opened in N. Phx!   Everything we loved at the previous location (charming decor, attentive wait staff, good food and Smithwicks beer) has been transported to the new spot.  We visited on a recent Friday night and were happy to see some familiar faces behind the bar.  I ordered the Ruben (delish!) and hubby had the chicken tenders.  The fellow sitting next to us at the bar was drinking a Guinness and we suggested he try Smithwicks.  He liked it so much, he had two!  We'll definitely be back, for more beer, fun and fellowship!

Met Sean, their awesome manager who was also our server and bartender for the evening. He was awesome and got our drink orders right away and had our drinks ready moments later. Played some Queen and The Eagles to mix things up and then back to the awesome Irish playlist. 
Loved the music. 

Monday was $5 burger day with $2 side. 

We got a Northsider and a Blu Cheese. Both were delicious. Fries were perfectly cooked and my salad had good veggies on it. 

We'll be back, for sure! Thanks!

Tim's has become our local.  We really, really like the food here.  I've had corned beef and cabbage at one other Irish bar in town, and it didn't even belong in the same category.  Tim's corned beef is flavorful and lean, and what the cook does with Irish bacon in his cabbage makes my toes curl with delight: I've never had better.  I could eat the Shepherd's Pie every day; husband loves the Garlic Chicken and gets extra Irish bread.  The Irish breakfast is good, the fish on AYCE Friday nights is fresh, fabulously lightly breaded and they'll make up cocktail sauce to order.  An earlier reviewer didn't like the corned beef taquitos and I agree - when I first had them I thought they were not good at all; I had some last Tuesday night (Pub Trivia night) and they were delish.  So are their fish tacos on Taco Tuesday.  Really, there is nothing they serve we haven't liked. I don't like bar food; I love Tim Finnegan's food.

The bartenders and servers are great; the bar has a wide selection of Irish and Scotch whiskey/whisky.  There are specials every night but Saturday, and happy hour all day Sunday.  It's a great place to gather with friends for good food and drink.

céad míle fáilte

If you like Irish pubs, this is it. 
No nonsense, proper drinks, great staff. Cheers.
Bomb place. Great food, great happy hour, great specials. Get the corned beef and cabbage taquitos!
Nga WHAT!!! This is a secret I don't want anyone to know about. But that wouldn't be nice. Taquitos are stupid good. I can't wait to go back. Reuben was really good too.

Pretty cool Irish bar on the southside of metrocenter.  Theres not much to go to metro anymore for but Tim Finnegans is a good reason.  

This place has been here for a long time and worth stopping by.  The inside is dim lit.  Theres a ton of wood.  The happy hour is decent: 5 bucks for wings 3 for fries and 4 dollar drinks.

The staff is all friendly and attentive.  There is even a band in there most nights.  If you are nearby and looking for a classic bar look no further. 

They even have a good selection of craft: grapefruit sculpin, fresh squeezed ipa, kiltlifter, and a few others.

Random.

I am sleeping. My friend wakes me up from my castle at 12am, banging on my door saying I have to go out to night! Clothes on, ID in hand...off I go.

He brings me to this place!!  I am not one for dive bars, nor partial to being disappointed.  Dives are necessary every once a while.  This place has the feel of a dive but has the crowd of a well established bar. 

Mixed feelings about this place. Curious how the weekends are?!

Almost out of my grog from my sleep, my buddies decide 3 tequila shots are due. Salt on, shot glasses in hand...off I go. 

The 'tender was a nice guy, seemed to like his job. Quick to the order and fast to the tab. Thank you!

 FINAL ThoughTs: Aside from the acres of room to sit, Tim's has what so many dives don't have, which is the personality of a reputable bar. A great place to go with friends after the daze of a treacherous weekend. 


NOTE: Avoid the patio after 12:30am. I have seen coke heads both times I have gone. Coincidence??  

R\_

Tim Finnegans is back and in a much better area!

I was sad when this spot closed down at GhettroCenter.  My friends and I would meet up there once in a while to catch up.  Its hard to find an old school feeling Irish bar worth going to in Phoenix.  

We recently met up at this new spot.  It has the old wooden bar with brass fittings and a cool green neon light underneath to give it a fresh feel.  

Unfortunately, the building it is in doesn't have much for a patio or cool look to the outside but we will take what we can get.  Just happy it's not a chain and they are back in business!

Excellent whiskey list and an okay beer selection.  Could use more independently owned craft beers (non sellout craft beers) and local craft beers on tap.  Local independent owners should support other local independent beer makers!

Will definitely be back!

Very good food and saw a great selection of beers. Servers were attentive. Inside could use a bit of a facelift but all in all a very good place.
Will come again

A friend had a Groupon for this place and asked if I'd like to go with.  I hadn't been here before and, always willing to try a new place, I said sure.
I'm being a little generous with the stars as I don't think I'd return to Finnegans, but this isn't really my type of place. It's definitely more bar than restaurant and I suppose it's just fine for drinkin'.  The big turn-off was our choice of seats, straight line to the smoking patio so the stench of stale cigarettes wafted by every few minutes.  Not their fault but still not very pleasing.
The food was decent, but again nothing I'd really run back for.  The fish and chips came with one gigantic piece of cod which was different and the mussels were also a little different-almost like mussel noodle soup.

Being a "First to Review" whore, I convinced Hubby we needed to try the pub with the huge "now open" sign on our way out of Metro Center. Donna D. beat me to the punch, but we are very glad we went anyway. The interior is full of dark woods, with framed pictures, metal and mirrored beer ad signs, a mural, and antique instruments on the wall. The music was great, from The Smiths, REM, and STP to the Red Hot Chili Peppers. A band was setting up as we were leaving. It was quite busy, but we were still able to get a table right away at 9:00 on a Friday night. However, by the time we left, there were no tables to be had and the outside smoking tables were also completely crowded. The customers were totally eclectic, from older very well dressed Scottsdale types to skinheads. 

The drink menu seemed pretty standard, with Scotches, Irish whiskeys, bottled and tap beer. The menu was not huge, but let's hope that they do all the food as well as our dinner selections. They made a grand claim that they served the only authentic Shepherd's Pie in Arizona, and Hubby just had to see if they were full of it. Soon he was full of the best shepherd's pie he said he's ever had, made with lamb and champs. I had the fish and chips. The fish was not quite Rosie McCaffrey's and the chips were not quite as good as Rula Bula's, but it was all very very good. The piece of fish was about 12x5" and super crispy, and the chips were potato wedges, well-seasoned and tasty. The tartar sauce was unusually tangy (and delicious) , but the cole slaw was served in a ramekin so small that it fit about a tablespoon's worth, but that turned out to be OK, since it was virtually tasteless. There were also burgers, sandwiches, cottage pie, and flat iron steaks on the menu, and a ridiculous sounding bread and butter pudding for dessert that we will be back to try (they were already out when we asked for it).

It was great to see a brand new place doing so well already, and Tim's will likely end up in our regular rotation of favorites.

UPDATE: We returned and had another good meal, and we noticed that a few things with my fish dinner had changed- less breading, more flavor in the coleslaw (mustard?), but the "chips" were a little soggy this time. We also got to try the bread and butter pudding. I'm not sure what to say about it- it's strange, for sure. A hot rectangle of cripsy on the outside and almost slimy on the inside bread pudding with a few pockets of raisins and a two note taste: hella sweet and bourbon. It was heart-stopping rich. The whole plate was drizzled with a slightly sweet thick butter sauce. It definitely  needed something else- maybe a little cinnamon.
i'm sorry. i love the hamburgers. and the shepard's pie. and while i had one bad experience a few years ago, i enjoy this place.

Was here on a Thursday night and there was live music! Bonus since that's usually reserved for Friday-Sunday at most places. 

My favorite Irish pub was the Johnny Fox's Public House, but it has since closed. :( So I began looking for a similar spot, although in no way does Tim Finnegan's come close in interior presentation as well as food, they do have a nice specialty drink selection and the staff is just as nice. 

The place is quaint with indoor as well as outdoor seating. The staff was not very attentive but were very friendly. I ordered the Irish Mudslide which was a delicious specialty drink and the small Shepherd's Pie. 

The lighting was relatively dark which makes it prefect for a casual date or a nice chill night out with friends. 

I would recommend this place, just remember to be assertive when you need something from the staff.

Went back to further explore the menu, and was happy with everything we ordered! Came during Happy Hour so all the appetizers and desserts were $5. We ordered 3 appetizers, and 1 dessert and we ended up stuffed, so $10 per person was not bad at all. After a couple of visits, my favorites are their desserts, the Bailey's Bread and Butter Pudding, and the Bailey's Tiramisu. Both are very delicious!

You can also request extra foam for your Guinness which is nice. And service has always been great here. No complaints, just wished they had a shuffleboard table and a real dartboard. They have a modern/high-end jukebox, and an electronic dartboard. They also have weekly events like trivia night, and karaoke.

Great place, nice atmosphere.  Very much like many of the pubs I have been to in Ireland.  The burgers are delicious, and at $5 on Monday, can't be beat.  Staff is friendly and they do pour the perfect pint of Guinness.

Another reviewer, Mary O. claims to have overheard the owner saying the anniversary raffle for the Ireland trip was rigged and gave the trip to his "best friend".  That is really interesting.  Since the winner is my husband, I was very surprised to learn he was best friends with owner.  So was my husband.  

We live nearby and go to Finnegan's multiple times a week.  During the month prior to the drawing we filled out an entry slip every time we went in.  We did NOT buy a raffle ticket.  If Mary Ol bought a raffle ticket, it wasn't for the drawing for the trip.

During a vacation, my friends and I decided to try to hit as many local places in town, and we were fortunate that this was the place we ended up at. 

First off, let me describe the food. For an appetizer we ordered the curry fries. Being from the Indian subcontinent, it was a must have, as I love English and Irish twists on Indian cuisine. It was so good! Perfectly cooked fries, and awesome curry. AWESOME curry dipping sauce. 

For my meal I ordered the Kalarney Chicken. To say the least, this was one of the best things I have had in my life. The presentation was gorgeous! Two perfectly cooked pieces of chicken sitting in a sauce upon a mountain of Irish mashed potatoes. It was delicious! Also, when I cut into the chicken, the chicken bled that beautiful brown grill color. I highly recommend this dish!

Lastly, Sonja, our waitress was really nice! She helped our next part of the part of the trip, and sat down at our table to talk to us for about a minute. It is not a lot, but, little things like that make a huge difference in my book. 

Definitely recommend.

Brought my mom here today (Tues) for lunch.  Not busy at all but seeing the great reviews for fish & chips, I knew this was where I wanted to try something new. Service was great, server was sweet & accomodating. Cute place, music that was playing was alternative rock - it was fine for us but not everyone's cup of tea. 

For starters we ordered the corned beef & cabbage taquitos. We had both imagined the chewy goodness of cabbage & corned beef being the filling. No, the insides are in fact blended together. Gives it more of a pate type consistency. Will not order those again. 

We decided to order the fish & chips and a blue cheese burger to share. Fish & chips definitely did not disappoint. Blue cheese burger was ok, but they served it on a rather burnt bun. If it would've been just  mine, I would've sent it back, but my mom likes some char, so she was good letting me have the less burnt half. Did not come with much blue cheese, which was disappointing. It was not chunky either, probably about 1/2 of a teaspoon of blue cheese dressing. Burger was a decent size. 

Soda was flat. Ordered coffee, quite a few grounds, but taste was good.  

Will still go back for fish & chips!!
Great food and drinks! Shawn will attend to all your dining needs! So friendly! Great happy hour. Seared Cod...delish!

Tim Finnegans is my favorite Irish pub they have awesome delicious food and drinks. .the wings, flat breads, sandwiches, burgers, fries and everything is good I have never had something that wasn't good from this place and I have been going for 5 years..they have happy hour every single day their bar tenders are really nice and always provide excellent service. .Rosie McCaffreys is a close second when it comes to Irish pubs.

Love the feel of this place. They do a nice job of not serving "pub grub". Artichoke dip was great but the Reuben taquitos could of been much better. My wife had the fish fry, which I thought was great. I had the authentic Shepard's pie and it was outstanding! Lots of Irish beers available.

Came here on a whim when we were being indecisive on a Sunday afternoon! It's laid back and really great atmosphere with wonderful service! Really good AUTHENTIC Irish food!!! The shepherd's pie is delicious and made with ground lamb! YUMMY! And the fish and chips are to die for (and on Fridays they are all you can eat for $15!) word to the wise, try the Left Coast Asylum!

The only bar for Jets Fans in Arizona! They have the NFL Sunday Ticket, plus they're the official home for team USA Soccer. They always have amazing happy hour, specials, and great deals. 

The lamb skewers are so flavorful, and as I'm writing this review I'm eating their $9 Corned Beef & Cabbage dinner which is one of the best I've ever had! Traditional Irish Bar owned by a cool guy named Tommy. Definitely a regular here and i encourage checking it out sometime.

If it's lent or you're craving fish and chips then head over to TIm Finnegans for a black velvet pint and an order of AYCE fish fry for $13! that  can't be beat. Oh and it's good fish and chips, the sad part is that it's hefty so unless you're really just craving alot of fish, you'll only be able to handle one serving of fish and chips that it'll be too hard to stomach a second plate. The pub has character, and on Fridays usually later in the evening they have live music. Overall a good pub to hang out, have some fish and chips, drink some pints of black velvet (for me) and have a good time!
I love Kristen. I love the food and the atmosphere. My coworkers and I come here often.

This review is from my previous visits- and going to another venue just to see JDV lit the fire under my ass to elaborate on my 'tip' from 4 months ago. After tearing Tommy a new one over the phone for allowing JDV to play in WestGate when he clearly does not belong there...lol, yeah, I tore him a new one...AS IF!!  
I wrote a freaking dissertation describing the horrible experience I had Saturday night & added to it Sunday morning...pretty severe and I'm surprised it is still a 'recommended review'!!! (Figured it'd be deleted).
Back to the task at hand. It's difficult to describe the TF's experience in regard to quality - BECAUSE my standards are ridiculously high- so what can you say when each time you visit, they exceed expectations. I'm dying to try the yummy food- but I go alone - so between worrying I'll overindulge and then the potential for needing a nap afterward....I live vicariously by checking out all the dishes & asking about them to customers(I am a self proclaimed pest. Yep.).
All I can say is: check it out. Plus if you yelp check in you get a free appetizer too. What's to lose?? (Also, the dudes behind the bar are pretty swank...nice eye candy and really nice--at the tables I'm pretty sure it's all female wait staff, no biggie but makes me happy that there's always a place for me at the bar)!!

It was OK but nothing special. They pulled a good Guinness, but that was it. It took almost ten minutes to get a waitress to my table, and they were hardly busy (it was 6:10pm, and there were only 8 people in the restaurant). I ordered the lamb shepherds pie. I was hoping for chucks of lamb meat mixed with peas, carrots, and onion. What I got was a ground up stew. It tasted ok, albeit a bit bland, but there was no texture. It was like eating baby food. It is my observation that when a cut of meat is below par, you grind it. Will I go back? Maybe. The one plus was that it was within walking distance to my hotel, so I could enjoy many Guinness and not have to drive.

Need a divey Irish pub with good grub? Done! Don't let the four stars fool ya, this place isn't fancy or a gastro-pub catering to hipsters... This is a dark, loyal locals bar with everything you'd expect in an Irish pub... Friendly service, traditional dishes (and the American standards too) wooden bar, tables and chairs, trivia, live music and DAY DRINKERS. The only thing it has going against it is its location (Metro Center)... But after an 8oz portion of delicious Fish n Chips (all you can eat on Fridays) Jameson and a Guinness, you wont care about that anymore... See ya next Friday :)

We met some long lost friends here last night.  Fast and efficient service.  The only issue was that music was to start at 9:00pm...we left at 10:30 and the music still had not begun.  At least we were able to chat with our friends but we were a bit disappointed as the sound check sounded great.  The fish sliders were super!  Potatoes skins needed salt.  I'd certainly go back.

Irish pubs are really my favorite places to eat, drink, and be merry.  Last Friday we knew we were meeting Tim S. for dinner at Cibo, so why not leave the 'burbs and go try some other places I have bookmarked on Yelp and just make a day of it?  

Tim Finnegan's was on the list and we had a great lunch.  We started with the mussels app which had some of the best broth I've ever had with mussels.  It was a little spicy, but not too much, and they put noodles in there which I've never seen before, but they soaked up the broth very nicely and made the meal more substantial.  I also really like the brown bread that came with it.  

Mr. M ordered the lunch portion fish and chips and I ordered the Rasher burger.  You know the food is good when there is very little talking, just eating.  That's what we did for the next 20 minutes, passing bites of fish and burger across our plates to each other and sharing the fries and green beans.  All perfectly done all the way around.  

The fish was nice and light with very tasty fries.  My burger was really exceptional and on par with the great burgers I've had at Fibber Magees and Skeptical Chymist.  Some of the best burgers I've had in this city were at places that don't market themselves as a burger joint.  

With a pint of Kilkenny, Guinness, and sharing one of Harp, our total before tax and tip was $36.23.  They have a great Yelp check-in deal and you can get the appetizer for free if you purchase two entrees.    

I loved the atmosphere with all the dark wood and small tables and booths.  Kristen took good care of us at the bar and we enjoyed her banter with some of the regular patrons.  I wish we lived closer to Tim Finnegan's, but now that we've given it a try, we'll be back for sure.

It's cool. It's dark. I like the music. The burgers and steaks are way better than I expected in a bar.

Great selection of beers, and the friendliest bartenders in town.

This time, I'm trying crab cakes, just to mix it up. They ought to go beautifully with this pint of Scottish Amber ale. :-)

Later : OH, yeah. The two crab cakes were tasty. Served with a flavorful aioli, salad and potatoes that were...like scalloped, but not creamy. I didn't look at the menu to see what they were called, but they were delicious!

First time here for happy hour, probably my last. Only 1 bartender/server working who likes to socialize. People waiting for their first order and refills. Management needs to rethink their staffing if they want to increase sales or maybe they just don't care.

The food is great and pretty consistent, there are many standards they've had on the menu for years. The owners are very community oriented. The happy hour and seasonal holiday events are terrific. There is patio seating (for the, ick, smokers). They often have live music and a game night.

We had the fish & chips-lunch portion and the Corned beef and cabbage. Cabbage was cooked just right. Mashed potatoes and gravy were good. They have Guinness and smithwicks on draft along with other selections. Nice pub atmosphere.  High end scotch and whisky on the menu as well.  Booths, high top tables and tables in the back.

Chill environment, seat yourselves so you don't look like a dumba** at the front. Haha but food was great as well as the service. The night we were there it was open Mic night so there was live music. All in all, I'd like to come back and try another one of em burgers! :)

We pulled up and the parking lot was empty and almost didn't go in! But we were very glad we did! We sat at the bar with our awesome bartender Harrison! He recommended my husband get Kilkenny Irish Cream and asked if he would like to try it with a drizzle of honey?! My husband is now obsessed!! Thanks Harrison...  
We got the Corner Beef & Cabbage Taquitos to start. My only complaint about this crispy dish is I'd like a little more seasoning. For our 2 entrees we got the small Fish & Chips (Cod was fried perfectly and so were the chips! Crunchy and yummy!) and the Sheapards Pie (I'm not a fan of Lamb but my husband loved it!) everything about this place was very Ishish in deed! We will be back! We hope to see more cars in the parking lot soon. But when we asked he said that is just how it gets in the summer!

I really wanted to like this place...i wanted this to be my new go to place...but it was disappointing for my first time. I will definitely return, but this review is based on this time.
Came for happy hour. Ordered a couple of drinks and some appetizers. As far as the food goes it leaves you wanting more out of it. Ordered a chicken and red pepper flatbread, the curry chips(fries) and the corned beef taquitos. Let me start with the taquitos: Where is the Beef?! It was all mashed potatoes inside no meat. The salsa verde is obvious canned sauce, and the only thing that stood out was the spicy mustard. Everything else was fried tortilla stuffed with tasteless mashed potatoes. This is whole point i wanted to come for those taquitos as they sounded so unique, but was i wrong. The flatbread had hard, dried chewy chicken. It was awful. The curry chips were ok, the curry sauce i liked but its curry sauce, you cant really mess that up.
Like i said i will come back and hopefully this time was just a bad day, because based on other reviews this place should be really good.
The fish and chips are amazing.  Service can be spotty, but overall it's really good.  I would definitely bring friends.

A solid neighborhood bar and the only Jets bar in all of Phoenix. If you're a misplaced Jets fan, be sure and check out the local Jets meetup group for Phoenix too, they meet here for every game. I don't especially love the food here, it's about as tasty as any other random sports bar in town, but the wings are a solid choice. They've got fish n chips, corned beef and cabbage, the usual Irish pub fare. 

I don't find myself in this part of town often, mostly for the football; that's football not föötbäll or however it's pronounced, although they do play the soccer games too. They've got a decent number of tv's and a large projection screen to broadcast the games, the wait staff is friendly and the drinks are decent priced. 

Honestly though, where else are you going to get to watch the best team in the NFL play with your closest friends? ;-)

Happy yelping Phoenix, are you ready for some football?!

I had no idea Tim Finnagan's was changing locations but boy am I glad!! This is now less than a mile from my house and I could not be more excited about that. We had already loved Tim Finnagan's but I do have to say we were never a big fan of the location. It was actually a bit scary. NOW... its in a big busy complex, its beautiful inside and out, super clean and tidy, but a LOT smaller. But not in a bad way. I think it is actually the perfect size. 

So a little story on how I discovered this place was here. I was driving to my hair appointment and noticed something new opening so I drove closer and literally parked my car and sent a very excited video to all my friends and family in the neighborhood. We don't get a lot of cool stuff over here so I was stoked to spread the word. Then... 3 hours later I came and got a drink with a friend. Then... 2 hours after that I came and got dinner with my husband. THAT is how excited I was. My husband got the Fish and Chips. 2 Huge pieces of Cod layered over a pile of fries, a side of coleslaw, and a side of tartar sauce. I tried some and it was very good. The only complaint is we kept seeing the fish come out stuck together which made that part very soggy. Besides that very crunchy and flaky. I got the Ruben Sandwich. It was melt in your mouth good. I love that they didn't pile everything high to the sky. I could taste every thing, the coleslaw, the thousand island, the corned beef, right down to the buttery toast and white cheese. 

The feel of this place is more elegant than the last location with wine barrels to sit and more of a rustic decor all around. That night they had some great live music to set the tone. We cant wait to make this place one of our regular spots to hang, grab a beer, eat, and watch some soccer games!!

My date took me to play mini-golf at Castles n Coasters, and we wanted to find a place to relax and have a drink.  We stopped in at Tim Finnegan's and sat at the bar, and four hours slipped away before we knew it.

Good atmosphere (typical Irish pub) and live music that was cool but not too loud for us to have a comfortable conversation.  Not too crowded, but the people there all were happy and having fun.

We had a few drinks, and we ended up ordering a turkey club and the brownie a la mode, both of which were tasty.

But the best part was definitely the service!  Harrison took great care of us and kept us laughing all night.

Small Irish Pub feel.  Food is great, but the service is on the slow side.  I ordered the cup of Bacon and cabbage soup and the Corned Beef and cabbage- it is St. Patrick's day or close enough...My only regret wS ordering the soup cup size instead of the bowl and the corned beef and cabbage lunch size.  Food was excellent!  The soup was slightly on the salty side, but went real well with the Irish Soda Bread.  The Corned beef and cabbage were tender and tasty and savory.  Ordered the Reuben and a Shepard's Pasty for lunch the next day.  If you can overlook the somewhat slow service, this place has great food and atmosphere.
I was in Phoenix on business last week. I absolutely enjoyed the friendly people and staff at this location.
Cheryl was a very good waitress and the food we ordered on St. Patrick's Day came out very quickly. To  bad they don't have any IPA's....

Okay so my office is real close to this restaurant & I was working on. Saturday & my husband says let's go try this place out.... so we did!!! I am soooo glad we did!!  

Great Irish pub atmosphere & decor!

Our waiter was Shawn & he was very friendly & helped us with menu selections... so many great options on their menu!  

So we started with the mussels appetizer as another Yelper mentioned it. Oh my Goodness so damn good!  My husband said you can have all noodles but he ate more of them than I did!  Again you must get this appetizer!  I just ordered one to go it was that good!!!

For our lunch I had the Reuben excellent & the husband had the fish & chips.  Shawn our waiter recommends the chicken or pan seared cod entrees.   Will try those next time.  Oh yes we will be back!  Haven't even left here yet and thinking about dessert....

If you are in the neighborhood stop in!!!!  Enjoy my fellow Yelpers!!!!

Wife and I went to T. F. today at lunch intent on corned beef and cabbage (me) and fried fish (her).  Waiter told us we could have the all you can eat fish for only 6 dollars more than the regular fish.  We took the regular fish.  What she got was either a very small piece of fish or half of a regular sized one.  Was fried up in a salty bit of batter.  Came with good cole slaw but there was only about two teaspoons of it.  Also came with some overcooked, limp and greasy french fries.  All for $9.00!!
My corned beef was good.Small portion again but good.  The cabbage was so salty that it might have been cooked in brine.  Fortunately there was only about 2 tablespoons of it.  It also came with mashed potatoes which were good but again super small portions.  My meal was also $9.00.  Iced tea was $2.25 and Harp beer (small glass) was $5.00.  Not too bad.
Chef needs to learn how big a serving size is.  He can't tell the difference between regular serving sizes and children's sizes.
HINT:  every day they have a different special.  That special is the big, that is to say regular size, for only a few bucks more.  So order the special even if it sounds big 'cause it isn't.  You'll actually save money because after we paid over $30 bucks we still went over to near by Carvers because we were still hungry.
Very sorry I didn't have the same experience that some of my fellow Yelpers did.
I guess this is a beer drinking place and food comes secondary.

This is the ONLY place for fish and chips!  I have tried other places around the valley and nothing compares. The atmosphere is fun and authentic with a wait staff that is friendly and knowledgeable. The burgers are good, and so is the flatbread....if you won't eat the fish. ;)

Had a Reuben. Not a Reuben. Cole slaw instead of sauerkraut. Very little thousand island dressing. Marble bread, not a strong rye flavor. Corned beef was bland too. Very, very, bland. I'm from Omaha, NE., born and raised, where the Reuben was invented. I'm also Irish. This is more of what's called a Rachel Reuben, except it sticks with the slightly corned beef instead of pastrami or turkey. A Reuben should have a sour and tang, stink a bit. Disappointed. Why they ruined such a beautiful creation is beyond me.

TIM FINNEGANS 2.0! !
They are resurrected at 59th Ave and Bell Rd. In the shops on the Northeast corner. Same food you love, best Fish&Chips in the valley! 
Excellent food, excellent service, excellent selection of fine whiskey answer CLEAN FRESH SMELLING RESTROOMS!!

I thought I had made quite the discovery while mini golfing last night when I saw that whatever crab house/fish tacos place here had gone under and been converted into an irish pub. Turns out there was that yelp event here. Well regardless I knew a couple of brews here would be the perfect accompaniment to the flask of scotch I took down at Castles n' Coasters.

I saw they feature 3 dollar Carlsberg's on tap and thought I was falling in love. Until they came. What is going on with the tapped beer here? I tried a Harp too, to see if it was just the Carlsberg, but both were strangely lacking their hearty flavor. I can't put my finger on it, because they weren't flat, but it was the poorest Carlsberg and Harp I ever had on tap. It also didn't help matters that the potato skins we ordered couldn't even stack up against Applebee's.

At least the had an "Irish" band playing. I could tell because my ears started to bleed green and orange. Is that supposed to happen? I don't think so, especially since half of the songs they played sounded more like they were from the band in the Swayze classic "Roadhouse" then befitting an Irish pub. Part of the problem just looks to be the natural acoustics of the space, but someone really needs to tell the house band that just because you can play loud enough to permanently make the entire pub crowd lose their ability to hear a violin, doesn't mean you should. They need to be able to play to the venue they have.

Timmy's also features a cast of entertaining, yet depressing characters, mostly of the mid-life crisis variety. There is Jig By the Server's Station with Your Heels Off Until Your Boob Falls Out Girl. We also got to see Take of Your Jive Hat So you Can Lick the Boobs of a Cardboard Cutout Beer Model Advertisement Guy. There was a brief cameo of I'm Gonna Wear My Gears of War Hoddie AND Hat Out Wherever I Feel Like to Make it Painfully Obvious How Much I Hate Human Interaction and Want To Get Home to Some Multiplayer Action Guy. There was the Sit as Close as Possible to the Band and Shout "Chug!Chug!Chug!" at Every Break Crowd. And of course who can ignore Lonely Guy Who Incessantly Claps at the Bar to Every Irish Anthem Played.

I have to give the place 3 stars for effort though, and for providing an escape in the metro center area that badly needed a dependable bar other then Applebee's. Even if the potato skins suck. At least I can now get blind stupid drunk for mini-golf. UYE?
Always have a great time and stop in every time we are in Phoenix. I can only give it 4 stars because the too k Bass off tap a few yearss back, but still my favorite place to drink in AZ

When we lived in Phoenix we were at the old spot at least once a week. They did a great job on the new location. The food was fantastic Sheppard's pie and fish and chips even better than I remembered. 
I'll be a regular every time I am in town.

Been here a few times since the new location opened.  All I can say is fantastic.  Have tried several different food items and after visiting Ireland and the UK several times this place is as authentic as it gets. Nicole is fantastic.  Jimmy is top notch.  You can't go wrong here.
Excellent place to hangout. Every item on the menu is awesome. I just love the pasties there and the curry fries. Love the beers and the live music is outstanding on the weekends.

Delicious food and a great atmosphere for family dining or hanging out with friends. It's just a really nice neighborhood Irish pub.
