I had the rasher burger with chips, plus I ordered a side of their homemade curry sauce to go with it. It was all delicious! My husband had the fish n chips which he really enjoyed. My 9 year old daughter had the chicken pot pie soup which she really liked.

We'll definitely be back soon.

After a long day sight seeing, we were in need of a pint and good food.  We drove around and saw dive bars and corporate restaurants ....and then saw Tim Finnegans. In we went and we were not disappointed...a taste of home!
This place is something different in USA..
Irish owned, the genuine artical.

We had the pan seared cod over chorizo...it was melt in your mouth good and we paired it with a pint of an Irish import Kilkenny .... that was only 4$... cheaper than we get in Ireland! 

The only thing we were disappointed in was absence of Jameson Rare on their menu...apparently it's not being made anymore...but the bar staff recommended something else that finished off the meal nicely! 

All in all...Tim Finnegans was wonderful...amazing food and drinks....offering great value and service. We'll be back!

Wonderful food and the Kilkenny Irish Cream Ale is fantastic!  I had the Kilkenny Chicken, my husband had the fish and chips, my FIL had the Bangers and Mash and my MIL had the Citrus Chicken Salad. Everything was fantastic, although my husband said the fish was a little greasy. The servings were generous and everything was very tasty. We will be back!

Update as of 12/29/12:
Owner let me know the mobile menu/prices are getting updated soon, so that should help folks out.. Never know when you might get a spur of the moment to head out there, but don't know the menu by heart..

Might have to head over for a $5 burger before flying out of state in a couple weeks.. =D

The ambiance and service were great. The seafood chowder and fries were awesome. The Reuben was poor. The corned beef was gristly and cut too thick and had coleslaw instead of sauerkraut  and Thousand island dressing.

Awesome! Really! What a great surprise. Many years ago, we came here with friends. I remember it being good, but we just never made it back. The Metro Center mall, and the shopping area where this pub is located, has really gone downhill and there are a lot of empty storefronts. But the pub has remained, and after having another meal, I can see why.

The food was so incredibly good! All of the entrees were beautifully presented. The seared cod was perfect - in fact, "the best cod I've ever had!!" was the comment. It came atop mashed potatoes which were described as "absolutely delicious" (and this from a mashed potato aficionado!) The shepherd's pie was traditional (lamb not ground beef!) and so tasty - yum, yum! The corned beef was cooked perfectly and very lean, served with tasty mash.

We didn't get a starter because we knew one of the decadent sounding desserts was in our future. And the Bailey's bread pudding - ahhhh, melt in your mouth awesome. 

Our server was friendly, good sense of humor and checked back with us frequently to make sure we were happy.

Awesome pub with food as good as any you'll find in a gourmet restaurant.

I really enjoy this hidden gem's  bear bones approach and low prices as it reminds me of an East Coast dive bar I once knew.  I'm not too keen on the attitudes and slowness of the bartenders, but really appreciate their drinks and bar food.  Most importantly I appreciate the live music and pretty eclectic playlist throughout the night.

I strongly suggest the barkeeps learn to be personable and friendly to ALL customers, regardless of whether we are someone you are "surprised" to see or who look different from the very average locals. All people like great music and a place to have a beverage  or meal, thanks! 

But, it looks shady when you have well drinks listed as four dollars on your website and I am being charged five dollars, or when you change my brother's ticket to show double the price he was supposed to be charged, and only change it when he calls you the next day. Or, when you offer a free appetizer with two entrée purchases, but I don't get offered that. Yikes!

I'll give it only two stars because customer service is essential to me, but if they clean up their acts, this could possibly shoot up to three. I think I'll speak to the management next time to avoid any further confusion about the importance of being personable and upholding scrupulous  business practices when working in the food service industry.

I have driven past this place many a time and wanted to stop in, but something always got in my way. 
Well, tonight was a special night and I finally got my chance to check out Tim Finnegans. 

As I walked through the bright red door I was hit with the authentic Irish smell of salty fish, not over powering, but just like I pulled into port. 

When I look around the bar I feel like I'm in an Irish antique shop, there is an old fashioned metal bike hanging on the wall with very old metal signage. It definitely has a neighborhood feel for me. This palce just gives off really good vibes to me. I would imagine that this is what an authentic Irish pub is like in Ireland.

The set up of the bar is very accommodating, they have a section that is lower than the regular bar which I assume is for little people and people in wheelchairs; and any place that is considerate of all their customers earns rave reiews in my book.

The LIVE music was great and a real treat. I like that they do this more than twice a week. 

I intereacted with two bartenders and four waitresses that night and I have to say everyone was very friendly and on the ball.

I'm definitely going back. If anything changes, believe me, you'll be the first to know!
Great atmosphere. They have live bands on Mon, Thurs, Fri., and Sat. It's a very chilled and relax place. They have most of the popular Irish beers on tap. Nice place to go watch sports.

Loving this new location. Everything is awesome and fresh...both the food and the overall restaurant. The server was attentive, friendly and prompt. The happy hour deals are pretty good and the food was yummy!

When I was younger I went on a trip to Ireland and we went to pubs all the time for dinner, this place took me back to Ireland with the food, look, and sweet greetings.

My whole family of 16 showed up and the service was spectacular. Sometimes when you walk into restaurants with a big group you can expect the waiter/waitress to be running around like a chicken with their head cut off.. not here. She handled it with grace. The food was also delicious. I got a blackened chicken sandwich and it was a dang good sandwich!
Love this place!!! Great happy hour and open until 2 every night. Melissa and Dave are amazing.

The food is top notch! Service is mediocre. WARNING! Do not go here on St. Patrick's day. $10 cover and for what???? Guy at the door says its for the band. WTH?? It's the same band they have on any other night that they don't charge for. Total ripoff. Then stand around for 30 min waiting on a drink and the bar tender gets it wrong!!

Bottom line, Great food, Great service. Prices pretty equal to other places. I think the Guinness is just a little higher than others but, other than that on par with most Irish pubs around town and i've been to them all. (Yes, really). The two things i'll say bad about this place is: never will I ever go here on St. Patrick's day ever again. What a debacle it was when we went there when they were at metro center and they charge for soda water. I couldn't believe that they charged 50 cents for soda water with a $6 shot of vodka. Never have I ever been charged for a mixer. I've been to a lot of high end bars that you would expect this kind of charge at and still, never have I ever seen a bar charge for a mixer and soda water at that! unbelievable. The first time we went here after their move to 59th ave. ordered two vodka sodas and had ordered a soda water in between. saw the charge for soda water and thought, that's a little odd but maybe its what they do for just a soda water. The second try we ordered just vodka sodas. No plain old soda water and saw the same charges. Ridiculous! They did remove the charge when asked. Not sure if I'll return.

Really enjoyed the experience. Food was really good, service was on key. We'll definitely be visiting again soon. It's so much nicer than the Metro Center location! Get your fries/chips well done! Nice to see this shopping center getting a new restaurant.

This is a St. Patty's day review.

They blocked off the parking lot. For some reason drinks were a tiny bit cheaper outside. Guinness was $5.75 inside & only $5 outside. Strange.

There was some band doing all sorts of cover songs. The song choices were great, but the band sucked! There was more live music inside which was a little more Irish authentic.

The people working here are hot. That's the guys, & girls. Yowza!

Only shitty thing about this place is if you try to order a soda or water you will get ignored. You're gonna have to ask 3-5 times before you get your non-alcoholic drink. Yes, I KNOW they make $$ off alcohol, but c'mon now... It takes 5 seconds to pour a soda.

The bathrooms became disgusting. That's too be expected & I'm not docking points for that. There are only 2 stalls though. Ladies, pee faster!

All in all this place isn't too bad. Decently pub like. I ended my night at Rosie's though & I think I'll skip Finnegans next year & go strait to Rosies.
Holy crap this place was delicious! I got the corn beef special it was one of the best meals I've ever had.

Tim Finnegan's Irish Restaurant and Pub is located in the 59th and Bell Road Shopping Strip anchored by the WinCo. (the restaurant is next to Cucina Tagliani) The decor is the typical Irish Pub, a little dark but homey. A little old fashioned with lots of dark wood and homey Irish things and a cool looking well stocked bar. The soft opening menu offers Modern Irish Foods, not so Irish Foods and Irish Favorites. On their website it shows that this restaurant (at old location) was featured on the PBS Check Please Arizona Restaurant TV Show. They say that they are Irish Owned and Operated. We were told that EVERYTHING is made by scratch in house. 

We started out by sharing the Wasabi Caesar Salad. We got a good size plate of fresh crisp romaine leaves that was tossed in a DELICIOUS dressing laced with parmesan. The salad was also topped with flavorful very crisp croutons. Delicious salad!

For dinner I tried the Fish and Chips. There is a choice of size platters either small 4oz or large 8oz. (both were reasonably priced) I went with the large. Everything on my plate was great. I received a lightly battered meaty juicy cod with a thin shattering crisp coating. The tarter sauce was well made and delicious. The generous portion of fries were hand cut and seasoned just so and the Cole Slaw was really delicious. It was a little wetter than I like but still it was really delicious and seasoned just so.

My husband tried the Lamb Shepard's Pie. It looked awesome with those piped potatoes on the top. My husband it it was very very good!

Our server was phenomenal. The owner or manager also welcomed us and checked on us.

This experience was a very solid 4.5 stars. I have to hold back on the 5 to see how things play out.

Irish eyes and Non-Irish eyes are smiling. This is a Great New Edition to this part of town. Thanks for opening here!

A new spot for my local rotation.

The selection is terrific and the taste is superb. If you love cod this is the place for you. It is served without the deep fry and the french fries taste like they do on the streets of London served in the cones. The staff is friendly but it is Irish so you sort of expect that. Not much of a wait and they served everything quickly and with a smile.

OMG! Get the bread pudding!  Its AMAZING!!!!!  Also got the corned beef, wasn't the best I've ever had.  But the one man band is really good, reminiscent of Jack Johnson.  Our server Roxanne was really sweet too.

Been to this place a few times in the last 2 years and always had a good time, so when I heard they were having an Open Bar for New Year's Eve I jumped at gathering a few friends to celebrate here. I called ahead to see if we could purchase tickets ahead of time or see if we can make a reservation. They said they were expecting a huge crowd so just to show up really early. Come New Year's Eve night my friends and I get there at about 845ish. Band wasn't on yet, there were still a few tables open abd the bar wasn't crowded at all. The hubby ordered some fish and chips to munch on with our beers. Wasn't impressed. Nor was I in the past when I tried their food other nights, so I didn't have high expectations anyhow. Open bar was just $20 for ladies, $30 for guys. It was well worth it!! Included all draft beer and a selection of shots. We definitely had a great time here and took advantage of the open bar. Bartender even let us know when there was a cab available outside when we were good and drunk. The bar never got too crowded and crowd didn't get too crazy - aside for a few girls who threw up all over themselves in the restroom. But you know everyone's having a good time when the ladie's room gets backed up and no one cares because we're all just having a good time chitchatting with each other - cat fight free.
Great food...fresh beer and great service on a busy Saturday night!  The band was real good too!

I have been to this restaurant a few times and the food and service are terrific. They have a great beer selection and several ciders. There are plenty of options for everyone on the menu, and when they have Irish Breakfast as their special it is the best in Arizona.

Occasionally one needs to do Irish . 
Irish I found this place earlier 
Irish I had another Irish creme  ale 
Friendly waitress , nice atmosphere

Love Tim Finnegan's! The grilled Reuben sandwich and french fries are the best in Phoenix!! The side salad with blue cheese was delicious!! 
Jalapeno Ranch dressing is house made and is great with the fries! 
Roxy, our server, was friendly and fast! Great service!
Tom the owner is so nice!! Always enjoy a night out at Tim Finnegan's!!

This was my first time eating here and I will definitely be a repeat customer! 

I ordered the turkey burger which is something I never get, it was good. Got the bread pudding for desert, it was good.

Our server, Roxann was on top of it and provided great service!

This is a perfect Irish pub - spacious but cozy, lovely with a hint of divey, great selection of beers, great service, live music, and excellent fish and chips.  

St. Patty's Day is coming up fast (and on that day, this place is mobbed - which might be fun!), so if you're feeling Irish, this is one of the few places in AZ that makes my little East Coast drinkin' heart feel at home!  Check out the live music on a Friday nights (there's a calendar with artists online).  

The only possible downside is the location - but that makes it all the better, if you're in the area!

Fish and chips are the same great quality as the old location but a complete letdown that there's no more AYCE fish fry on Friday.  Drove an hour for nothing.  I miss the old menu from the previous location.  The manager and wait staff were very apologetic and hopefully they'll incorporate the popular Friday special into the new location.
Great food! Awesome owner. I had the Reuben sandwich and the corned beef was so flavorful and tender. Highly recommend!!

Went for HH yesterday.  This is an pub type atmosphere.  Lots whiskeys and beers on tap.  Irish menu with Shepard's pie, and fish and chips, cornbeef and cabbage, along with burgers and  salads too.  I had the fish and it was excellent crispy battered deep fried cod.  Just the way I like it.  Another at our table had the corn beef and cabbage and was not disappointed.  2 steak salads were also a hit.  Overall everything was excellent.  Just don't come in ordering foo foo drinks, it's a pub.
We will definitely be back.

Although I've been to Tim Finnegan's a few times before, my most recent visit was because I bought a Groupon. I had the small fish (it was a Friday) and a couple of beers. The server seemed new but she was very sweet. I will come here again.

Tim Finnegan's is a badass Irish pub & probably my first choice to grab some beers in the Ghetro-center area. If you're looking to go there for drinks & entertainment, then you'll have a good time. 4 or 5 stars for the pub environment.

For vegetarians, this place gets 2 stars for the food. For non-vegetarians, my fellow diners also have not been impressed with the food.

So to summarize: eat elsewhere and then head to Tim Finnegan's for drinks & entertainment.

This was our first time going to this place, we've been to other Irish pubs and loved them. This place, made you feel like you were not in Arizona. It had that vibe of Ireland, the live music, the rugby on TV that would make you question if you're really a man cause of how tough those guys are. The staff was friendly and the service was okay. Some food items took a little longer to get out than they should have and even some drinks took longer than they should have. The appetizers were delicious and during happy hour makes them reasonably priced. I personally ate the Rasher Cheese Burger, visually, it was a good sized burger! One that makes you question how you're going to fit it in your mouth to take a bite. Taste wise, it was very bland and a little burnt. I ordered medium and it came back well done (that's probably why it was burnt a little). So that's why I gave 3 's. For the wait times for food and drinks and the flavorless burger.
Is this an Irish pub or a Scottsdale club? Having to tell over each other because of the loud hip hop is pretty annoying. Drinks are cheap.
Seriously the best service ever! The food is delicious and they have the best Guinness ever! The best I've ever had!

I have a habit of always ordering potato salad and shepherds pie if they are on a menu. It's just my odd thing to do.

With that thought in mind can you guess what I enjoyed for dinner tonight? Yes it was a lamb shepherds pie. And it was just what I hoped for - subtly different than any before. The key difference was that the 99% was lamb, with a few carrots and peas thrown in. The lamb was good but a little dry,

Hubby is the same about ordering fried cod as I am about the potatoes and pie mentioned above. He had the dinner size portion and the piece of fish served was large. The dish was accompanied by fries and coleslaw.

What I wish Finnegan's did different was seating. We had to wonder around looking for table, it was like the parking lot at the mall on Black Friday. People circling around looking for the elusive parking space before any one else sees it. In the end we hovered near a guy paying his check at the bar and grabbed his spot when he finally decided to stop playing with his phone and leave.

Finnegan's had plenty of staff and there was minimal waiting for food and drinks. We will be back.

Our tab with food, one beverage and tip cane to $41.

Our favorite place!  Who knew I liked corned beef and cabbage. None better anywhere! Fish and chips right up there! Can't go wrong no matter what you order!  Staff is fantastic! Don't forget to order a Guinness and always tip generously !
Found this pub on yelp and are so glad we did! Very good fish and chips on Fri night and the pan seared cod was awesome! ask for Morgan B.  She had all the menu secrets! Back again asap.

I really love this place! 
Yes it is in a strip mall-what isn't? 
But, when I was sitting inside listening to the great live music and drinking my Guinness I felt like I was back in Michigan or somewhere back East where old school Irish pubs and hole-in-the-wall bars are much more prevalent than trendy clubs and lounges. 

Great service! 
The place is huge and has your general bar food and full bar. I have yet to try anything besides their beer but I am sure I will be back in the future!

Went back to listen to Shay Veno perform. What a great place to hang out in the neighborhood! (although the music started about 45 minutes later than was advertised, which wouldn't be AS big of a deal if it wasn't a weeknight...)

BTW, the corned beef and cabbage taquitos are really good!! 

Definitely worth keeping an eye on this place...  I plan to go again...

Disappointing. The wasabi Caesar salad had no trace of wasabi and the dressing was too thick. The shepherds pie came with a soup spoon but I have no idea why; there was no gravy at all and the mashed potatoes were dry and cold.

Lovin' the new pub!  I've been there three times in the last couple of weeks and have to admit that I'm hooked. Where else can you get Strongbow on tap, and The Pogues, Dropkick Murphy, The Tossers, and Flogging Molly on the box?!! The food isn't half bad either!

They have a phenomenol HH with apps at half off and drink specials that actually make it reasonable. My first trip came in at $25 for three apps and 4 pints. We sampled the wings, some weird little sausage rolls, and the corned beef and cabbage taquitos (which I must say were quite tasty in a really unexpected way). The best part was that Donelle (ask for her if you are there), lined me up with the second pints 2 minutes before the prices went up to save me a little moola!

They have live music three or four nights a week, pub trivia when there is no band and sunday afternoons they do Seisiun (think fraggle rock with Irish or celtic instruments). Check out their website for details shows http://www.timfinnegans.com/index.htm

This place is comfortable, way not pretentious, and may just be my new home away from home!  Slainte  : )

love this place, great layout and ambiance, plenty of parking and the food was great.

couple of suggestions
the night we were there there was a guy and a guitar, loud and not connected to the crowd.
have the bartenders learn how to pour guinness correctly, mine was fast poured and no crown on the pint
Nice pub with a cool atmosphere! The drinks are unique and strong! Definite must try for a unique experience! Great service with outdoor seating and some nights they have live bands!

I had the chicken wings which were, eh.  The corned beef and cabbage taquitos were disgusting.  They tasted like refried bean taquitos, and the filling looked like refried beans.  The fish tacos are wonderful, though. It's all about the Pub here! Five stars for the bar! Great whiskey and scotch selection. I mean they have The Balvenie 15 year! 

The decor: warm pub atmosphere

OMG, so good! I've been here twice to sample their food and every time it has been amazing! Today we did the half off appetizers for happy hour and tried five different varieties, and again, SO GOOD! Great service both times as well. We will return!

When I'm in the mood for an Irish pub I go to Tim Finnegans. Guiness on tap, of course, my favorite Scottish ale, Kiltlifter, and amazing food make this a great place to stop with friends. Live music will fill the joint and a good game will bring a noisy crowd, or if you want a quiet evening drop in on a quiet Monday and enjoy a Dirty Kilt amongst the dark wood interior with the friendly staff. 

I like Finnegans and all its moods and I know you will too.

These guys are great! A diamond in the rough. Say hi to Tom and Jimmy behind the bar grab a proper pint and get some authentic Irish food. If I lived closer, this would be my neighborhoof spot. I hope they open another spot soon.

I really enjoyed it here. It was pretty chill for a Friday night but probably the best atmosphere of any Irish Bar I've been to in The Valley. The Garlic Fries KICK ASS!!!!. Holly did some great acoustic covers....will definitely be back
Delicious food & Carlsberg on draft. My mouth is watering at the thought. Scrumptious! :)

Been here 2 times in the past 60 days, and I am here to tell you that there's a lot to like about Tim Fiinnegan's;

1. Nicely decorated Irish-style pub/restaurant.  For the Metrocenter area, this is 5-star.
2. Friendly, competent, smiling staff.
3. Kid/family friendly (ok, during happy hour and early dining hours, admittedly)
4. Very reasonable prices
5. GREAT Happy Hour prices
6. Solid, if not spectacular, food; very good portions

Need I say more?  Go to Tim's, a good, honest restaurant providing value in an otherwise underwhelming neighborhood.
Love this place. Not quite as homey as their last location, but the service and quality is unmatched.

Came in last Friday night, a little after 9 or so, to meet up with some friends in town from Denver. They were in for just the weekend and had suggested the place but I was definitely eager to check out a "new, to me" pub that's on my side of town. 

Upon entering, it seemed to have the right feel and charm to it. Plenty of beer mirrors and signage, decent whiskey selection, Carlsberg on tap, and that dimly lit pub feel. After greeting my friends and grabbing a stool at the bar it all kind of stopped there.  Once I flagged the bartender down, he flung a coaster at me and kind of gave me a blank stare.  I was fully prepared with my order but was kind of taken back by the "what the hell do you want" attitude on my first drink of the night. As far as I could tell, there were three others at the bar top when I sat down, with one just having tabbed out next to me. Ok, slow night but come on man, what's with the sour attitude. Got my drink, brushed it off, and continued on with socializing with my friends and enjoying the atmosphere, until another friend sat next to me at the bar top. He received the same treatment, a Frisbee toss of the coaster and a "what?" from the bartender. As he walked away to get my friend's drink, I explained how he did the same thing to me and it must be how they do it here. "Keep Going sure It's Grand"

What could have possibly be the savior for this place that night was the open mic gig playing in the far corner across from the bar. She belted out some Adele covers and green day song or two that sounded awesome!  Huge props to her for continuing to play with only a hand full of people in the bar on a Friday night. 
Once again trying to get service from one of the two bartenders talking in the corner with each other was like pulling teeth. After begging for another round, we decided our second drink was enough and we'd take off to another spot.  We had even offered to by the singer a drink because she sounded awesome, never got that one either. 

3 Stars because they had a live singer... 0 Stars for the service. 
However, because I think I would real like this place under different circumstances, I'd give it another try and hope for a different bartender.

As regulars on a Friday night I would expect some consistency. That is the case with the food. Always outstanding. However, service has been very lacking the last 3 maybe 4 times. I know that you are are bar. My family owns one too.. this doesn't mean you employ people that obviously do not care for your customers. Slow to come take an order and chasing them down for drinks or waiting 30m to pay the bill with not a drink in hand. Im sure you might get a few that just leave. The food is the only thing that saved this review from not being a 1 star.
Also, on a side note. If you have regulars that show up every Friday for the fish fry because it is good. Maybe you should let them know next week we will be charging $10 a person at the door regardless for St. Patty's day. Or not even letting us in to place to go orders now that we showed up and obviously are not going to pay to get in so we can pay to eat. THAT'S A ZERO STAR!
We will have to think about coming back. Again your food keeps us coming, but the service is making us think twice about it.

Great beer, authentic food, awesome atmosphere. Happy hour is 4pm-7pm Monday - Friday which includes $1 off Irish draught beers, $4 wines & wells, $2.75 domestic bottles & about 7 different appetizers. Also, there's always something going on during the evenings .. Tuesday - Trivia, Wednesday - open mic, live music on Friday/Saturday, & karaoke on Sunday. Although smaller than the old location, it's much more clean & updated.
You can eat fish and chips is very tasty comes with coleslaw the beer here is ice cold I would recommend it to anyone

Overall its a great environment. The ambiance reminds you of a cabin atmosphere and the drinking hole is were all the entertainment happens. Bartenders are friendly and the menu is nothing to sleep on. If either looking for some cold beers or good food this is definitely a spot you come to on this side of phoenix. Evenings are a cult following of industry workers from the restaurants and bars around the area good music and great lighting.

Seriously first experience watching a soccer game at an Irish pub and what a way to get broken with the champions league finals ! I got there just in time for the match to begin and found a corner spot to enjoy my blonde Guinness , fish and chips and a bacon cheeseburger ! The staff was friendly and accommodating. Will be back soon!

Went to Tim Finnegan's for happy hour tonight. Service was EXCELLENT, was served a Carlsberg and wings within 5 minutes of being seated. Food was well above average pub grub (I've been to their brother pub in Scottsdale, the Skeptical Chemyst and knew what to expect). Great appetizers (Wings, PEI mussels, short rib sliders, crab cakes and a whole bunch of great flat breads) that are half price daily from 4-7 pm! Great selection of imported beers on tap and in bottles, as well as whiskeys. Good pation and good sports viewing throughout. I'd give it a "5" but I'm a tough grader, lets call it 4 1/2 and if they continue to impress, we'll see!

Went on Friday after work. It was pretty crowded. For my taste it was too dark. Our waitress helped me choose a beer and it was a good choice. The burger was pretty good, however it wasn't what I ordered. I am so used to not tasting strong blue cheese when I order a blue cheese burger, and we were busy talking, that I did not realize I got the wrong burger by mistake until about halfway through I bit into a jalapeno. Turns out it was entered wrong but by then I was not ready for another whole burger. The waitress got it comped and she was really apologetic. I think with more light I would have noticed it right away. Overall it is a 3.5 that would be OK to meet somebody at but maybe not my first choice.

Best Irish Pub in all of Maricopa County, probably in the entire state! None of the other pubs I've been to feel as authentic and lack the atmosphere of Finn's, nor does the food at any of the others seem to stack up against theirs. They also have an excellent whiskey selection, something lacking at many of the valley's pubs and bars.

Great pub! We stopped in here by chance and I'm glad we did. We had just eaten dinner so we were just looking for a good spot for drinks. The atmosphere was great. We enjoyed our night so much we came back in the afternoon for some grub. Tasty food, solid drinks, friendly staff... I'll definitely be back!

This is the best food outside of Ireland. I had the Shepherds pie & my husband had the the seared cod with mashed potatoes & green beans. The food was outstanding, piping hot   & great tasting as food should be, great service from Alex. Fast friendly & communicative.
Met Tom the owner who is friendly & knows how to run a great Irish pub....he greeted us like we were life long customers....now we are! ah that's because he's one of the great ones from the auld country. If you have not been here it's a must. They have a great menu with a choice of two sizes of main course items, so whether your hungry or thirsty, this place is a great choice. The Kilkenny is a great beer.
Great craft beer selection..crabcakes are very yummy and loaded with crab...the wasabi aoli is a nice accompaniment. ..definately has that Irish Pub feel!!

LOVED the food!  We finished dinner as the live music was starting.  Next time we will come later to enjoy!  My husband had the all-you-can-eat fish.  It was very tasty and the fish was cooked perfect.  Nice big pieces of cod that were firm and NOT mushy.  I had the lamb shepherds pie.  It was FAB!  We also got a FREE order of Chicken wings to take home, just for doing a Yelp check-in.  We ate those later that night and they were GREAT!  Can't wait for our next visit!  Oh, and don't forget the on-tap Guinness...Yummmm!

If your in the area this place is a must. I travel and eat out a lot. I can honestly say this is the best burger I have ever had anyplace. The fries are also fantastic, and I don't really like fries. But they hand cut them. Draft beer is import only but all others are offered. The location is weird. It's in a strip mall that seems under construction but if you can find this place your will be pleased. Service good too. Will be back next time I am in the area.

Solid 4 star Irish pub experience. Food is pretty good! I've been here several times. I've had a few of the burgers, shepherds pie, mussels, lamb skewers, and the wings. All of which were tasty choices, I was not disappointed. They have a nice selection of rotating craft beer taps. Guinness of course is done correctly, just a perfect creamy pour every time I've ordered it. The whiskey selection is decent too, and is modestly priced. I've never had any service problems. Live music is a great addition, and we have been to the trivia night on Tuesdays a few times as well, which is a lot of fun. We haven't been to trivia since it switched our from Geeks who Drink to whoever the new provider is, but the word is they are still doing trivia. Some of the entrees come with a side of soda bread that is just amazingly delicious. We were able to purchase a loaf of this bread a few times on our visits. Its worth asking if you try it and like it.

Excellent atmosphere! Much better location than their other location. True authentic Irish fare! From the drinks to the options on menu. I had fish and chips and other person had Shepard's pie. Yummy!!!
What a fun Pub for a chill place to hang out in. The food is amazing! Great selection. The music after 9:00 pm turns into more of a up beat music.

In the mood for a pint of Guinness on a Tuesday night ... decided to give this pub a try.  My friend found the crab cake appetizers to be very good.  I found the Corned Beef dinner to have a different texture from fresh-cooked corned beef at home; we decided it had to do with pre-prepared and pre-packaged corned beef.  The taste was good, however.  On a week night it was hard to gauge how popular this place is; not many groups, about 4 besides us, at Happy Hour.

So much better at the new location. Still a little pricey for what it is though. They have some great live music from time to time. Went and saw Jason Devore from Authority Zero here and had a good time.

I used to play on a Coed indoor soccer team that was sponsered by this bar and that is when I started to go here. If you are into authentic Irish bars then you absolutely must stop in. It is in a kind of hidden corner but once you walk in you will realize how charming it is. Even the bartender is actually Irish! They have $3 Carlsberg all day every day and other great Irish beers and ciders on tap. As far as food goes I have only had their fish and chips but it was delicious. We stopped in last Saturday night because they are the only Official US Soccer bar in Arizona and we wanted to watch the game. We were pleasantly surprised with the live music they had that night. It was really great and I think we will be going more often now!

Very genuine Irish bar. In Ireland, people don't go around playing fiddles all the time, so I'm OK with this place not having had that when I visited :) 

As far as the location, it has plenty of parking, it's very roomy, decorated well, clean & the staff is helpful & friendly. 

I went there to watch a UFC game & I was lucky to get there early enough to get a seat at the bar, right in front of the TV :) They also show soccer games, which you'll be hard pressed to find in many places. 


The food portions are big, at least for me, lol. My friend had the Sheppard's pie & he went on about it for days, so I guess it was THAT good. They also have plenty of options on draft & were willing to give suggestions for mixed drinks. I don't remember what the drink I had was called, but it was yummy! Great bar tender.

If you don't want to get freaked up, don't go there this week, they are closed for floor maintenance. Their ignorance cost us 2 uber rides and half an hour in Phoenix sun. Asked them to update status on yelp and website so that this won't happen to anyone else, but they haven't yet. So a friendly warning to anyone else yelping for fun this weekend you are on wrong page now, hit the back button n move on or call them to check their status. Happy holidays.....
Their corn beef and cabbage is delicious. My husband and I came here on St. Pattys Day and it was a lot of fun.

Went with a group because it was close to hotel. The service was good to start it took at least an 45 minutes to get food. When food came it was cold. Looked good but frys were cold and sandwhich were all cold. Would not go back considering the place was not busy. Very disappointing.

Last night was my first time here. I heard it was good Irish food so I decided to give it a try along with six other friends. We arrived at 8:30 and there were a couple of occupied tables but it was mostly empty. 

Our server seemed completely overwhelmed by our party of seven. She was very nice, but I don't think she was having a very good night. Her memory was pretty bad last night as well. We were there for the food though so let's talk about that...

We tried starting with a few appetizers. I say we tried starting off with the appetizers, but everything came out at the same time. I HATE that! Lamb skewers, chicken tenders and pretzels with cheese. All were very good, but the homemade pretzel was probably the best one. The flavor was just right. I hate nothing more than an overpowering pretzel flavor that takes away from anything else, this one was perfect and the cheese sauce was fantastic. The chicken tenders were very good as well with what I think was a delicious beer batter coating. Lamb skewers had good flavor and were served with a mint yogurt sauce and a small salad...they could lose the salad, kind of pointless. 

Moving on to dinner...I just ordered another appetizer, the pasty. You can choose from beef, chicken, shepards pie or veggie. I chose the shepards. They really didn't do much for me, in fact they would have been pretty disappointing if it wasn't for the gravy they are served with. 
Two people in my group ordered corned beef and cabbage and loved it, two people ordered the fish and chips and said it was pretty good and one person ordered the black bean burger and said it was very good. So all in all, not bad, but it sounds like the corned beef was the winner. 

As for cocktails, stick with something simple or drink beer. They make a pretty horrible martini! 

In the end, they have decent Irish food but if you want to enjoy an appetizer first, you might want to hold off on ordering your entree because the server might not understand the concept! 

Enjoy!
The barkeep was awesome! He made excellent recommendations for whiskey and service was fast and friendly

What a great find. We came for spring training and found Tim Finnegans. We came on a Sunday night during happy hour. One of the best happy hours around. The food was fantastic. The lamb skewers were to die for. The service was fantastic. We have told all of our friends to go to Tim's when they come to Phoenix. They and you will not be disappointed.

First time that I had Shepherd's Pie. It was good and filling. They told me that real shepherd's pie is made with ground lamb; that's how they make it here. It went well with a pint of Guinness. I will definitely come back and try the corned beef and cabbage. 

Bartender was cool, service was great, food was good, and beer was cold. I'm a fan.

I really like this place. I typically go for happy hour with the girls, but I drug my husband there last night. They have wonderful beers on draft, and the food is a nice change from typical "bar food".  My husband and I had several Smithwicks, which were cold and were delivered in a timely manner. I had the steak salad. It was a little fatty, but the dressing was awesome. Ben had the sliders, which were moist and tasty. Our server was friendly and prompt. I only have 2 small issues with this place: first, I like to sit on the patio, but every time I go there, I have to go inside and ask for service. After I ask, I usually have great service, but I would prefer to be served without asking. Second, the crowd is sort of strange. I love eclectic people, but every time I go there, there are people who try to have these strange, conservative-laden conversations with me. Not that I am intolerant of people's views, but I am having a convo with the people I came with, and it feels strange to be randomly interrupted by strangers. Not the bars fault, just an observation.

This place is amazing! We went there to celebrate St. Patrick's day. It was busy but the servers were all very friendly. The food was great too. The garlic fries and corned beef and cabbage were amazing. The bread pudding was the best I've ever had. This is my first review of a restaurant on Yelp but I just had to comment on it. You must try this place!!

We haven't been to this bar in many years.  We went a few days ago and had a great experience.  I ordered the southwest chicken wrap and it was soooo good.  It has grilled juicy chicken, jalapenos, lettuce and some kinds of cheeses etc...  It was moist and just hot enough to keep me happy.  I loved every single bite.  My friend ordered a shepard's pie and he too was super impressed and devoured it.  The service was fantastic, prompt, friendly, and gave great beer suggestions for my friend.  I was surprised that they had a good Sauvignon Blanc, and I am a very picky wino, so I will definitely be back for that.  The music was not too loud, just right thankfully, and the people all seemed pretty normal-type, just in there to relax, unwind, be friendly, and have good food, drink, and service.

Oh Tim, oh Tim. You let us down today. A day after St. Paddy's day with an amended menu. Whoever heard of such a thing? Ok, but at least you should do well with what's on that amended menu. We ordered the garlic chips- fish and chips and a hamburger, and three glasses of wine. The burger was awful with barely edible wilted lettuce and the fish was 3/4 fried dough and minimal cod inside. Wine pours were small for $7. Grand total of $62. Not my idea of a lunch special. The one star was for the wait staff who were indeed friendly. Sorry, it'll be awhile before we return.

We've had several items on their menu. Faves are the fish n'chips, the shepherds pie and their wings. The fish has a wonderfully crisp shell and its tender and delicious. The tartar is creamy and flavorful, the fries delicious! The shepherds pie is made with lamb (rare in Phx!) and the wings are hearty and crave-worthy. The bread pudding is amazing & highly recommended! Fantastic Irish brews on tap too! Try it, you will love this place!

Best Irish fare in Glendale!  Gorgeous bar that has to be seen to be believed (the heart of this pub).  Mitch, our bartender/waiter was friendly, fast, and on-the-spot with everything we ordered.  The Shepherds Pie was perfectly cooked, and perfectly portioned.  This is our first visit to the new location, and we are very impressed.  We will be back! 
P.S.  This place has the BEST bread pudding of any we've tried!

This is my first trip since the move from the old location and met up with a friend. Pleased that it's around the corner from my house and I hope they have staying power like the old location but there wasn't too much to be pleased with for Happy Hour today. A surprisingly quiet atmosphere.  Beers were cold, Spinach Artichoke dip was good, pretzel dips were good but pretzel was chewy.  The service was SLOW.  It was not a crowded Happy Hour and not sure why it too more than 5 minutes each time to get an order in for my first and my next round and closing my tab.  It makes it difficult not to walk into Popo's next door for the next happy hour trip to this parking lot...
I hope I just caught a bad day.

After a 10-mile bike ride to work I stopped by Tim Finnegan's last night to grab a bite to eat - I'd been here before with some friends to sample the appetizers at happy hour, and was intrigued by their selection of food featuring interesting twists you wouldn't expect, like corned beef & cabbage taquitos! Whoa!! I knew this place would have something to satisfy.

After working up quite an appetite, I ordered the Irish breakfast - sausages, white and black pudding, toast, eggs, bacon, tomatoes, beans. WOW! It came on a huge square plate, covering the entire thing. Looks like a lot of food, but was just the right amount. The 'over-easy' eggs were cooked PERFECTLY - not your usual runny-and-barely-done mess, but exactly how I like them. I try ordering over-medium at other places but it always comes out runny. I'm really particular about my eggs, and it's relieving when you get someone that knows how to cook them right. The toast was hefty and tasty, bacon and sausage delicious. I swore off black pudding after trying it once at the Dubliner but figured I'd give it a try again - completely converted!! I know this is weird, but it reminded me a tiny bit of mincemeat pie - savory and spicy. The white pudding was great, too. 

Service was great, from previous descriptions I may have had Tom (?) - we sat at the bar and he was fast and direct. Even the cook came out to ask us how our food was! 

I had a great time. Like I posted on my Facebook page, "I think that's the closest thing to a holy experience I've had with food for a while!" :D
great atomsphere, music, food, and beer.  Here watching the NCAA Hoops Tourney.  Bookmark this place!

Finally back in Phoenix with the hubby for a week or two and I have to drive up north to visit with a friend in from Buffalo to talk about networking and marketing. I need some dinner and a beer before I head to my little schmoozefest and remember that the recent Yelp Elite event (that I missed because I was out of town) was held at this place. 

We find Tim Finnegans and decide that we want to sit outside and enjoy the beautiful night air after my month in the frigid northeast.  We walked in to get menus and I noticed that the place seemed huge, but I walked through and went outside so I didn't get to see much.

Outside there are numerous shiny new wooden tables with benches at which to sit.  Our waitress meets us outside and quickly takes our drink orders.  We peruse the menu for our choices, and by the time she comes back are ready to order.

We chose chicken wings as an appetizer, because that's how we roll.  The wings were meaty and pretty good.  If I were reviewing only them, I would probably give them 3.5 stars.  No Franks, but the sauce was a good combination of hot and vinegary.  They could have been a little crispier.

I ordered the Shepherds Pie, which claims to be the only authentic pie in the valley.  I'm not sure what makes it authentic, but my guess is the lamb.  I've never seen it offered as a lamb dish before.  Unfortunately, I was too full from the wings and couldn't take more than a few bites.  I'll eat the leftovers later, because from what I tasted this meat and potato dish was pretty yummy.

I'd give the whole restaurant 3.5 stars and round it up to 4 for the willingness of the owners to open an original restaurant in the land of chains.  I would definitely go back and try it again if I have time while I'm here.

I can't believe I haven't written a review about this place yet! I absolutely love this place and it totally is overlooked by a lot of people around the area. It's a in a run downed area by the metro mall, so it's not a surprise that people just by pass this place. Hell, I use to! But not anymore. 

I go there quite a few times now, or as much as I can. It's a great spot for some live music! Hanging out with friends! Beer! And food! It really is a great little hole in the wall bar. I love this Irish bar. And they're certified to pour the perfect Guinness!

The old location used to be way better. They lost some of their charm with the new location. Beware of the shepherd's pie. They no longer make it with lamb chucks, they now use ground lamb. I ordered it and it was all grease. We tipped it over and the grease just kept on coming. We ended up sending it back as it was inedible.  The fish and chips continues to be on point.

Hubby and I are regulars here. Love going there for happy hour or on mondays for burger day and happy hour.
They have the best Turkey burger I have ever had and if you are interested, you can substitute the fries for a side salad. They told me the turkey burgers are made super fresh in the house and you can definitely taste it.
I have now tried almost all of their appetizers and they are all pretty good, too.
The bartenders are all very nice and make you feel welcome and comfortable. 
Happy hour, great food and service, live music on weekend nights and close to my house=couldn't get any better.

GREAT Irish pub! i went on a Friday during the live music performance. I can't remember the name of the band, but they were awesome! The lead singer/guitarist was way into the crowd and got everyone hyped. I only had a few drinks, but a Sailor Jerry was only $3.50 and was very strong! I like cheap strong drinks! Definitely a good time. Will have to go back and try the food.

Nice atmo, friendly service, decent food. This isn't very Irish to me, but at least it's not a sports bar with an "Irish" brand. This is a nice place to meet friends and hang out. Trivia night was pretty awesome and they have a decent concert calendar.

Came here for happy hour and dinner, thought we'd give it a try.  The Buffalo wings were dry and cold, the mussels appetizer tasted like dirty dish water.  Ordered burgers medium rare, but received well done.  Cream of Chicken soup was ok and the fries were pretty good.  One saving grace was that the server was very friendly and prompt.

A Saturday night.  Ordered Shepherds Pie which was fine.  Two orders of fish and chips which were not.  The cod had been frozen too long too many times and was virtually unedible. It peeled off the breading at the slightest pressure.  Bit slow on service and the table was sticky from previous visits.  Chips were xlnt and the waitress (red hair classic irish) was very attentive and accomodating.  Service gets a 5.  Food prep a 1.

I can't really comment on the food. But seriously this place has Kilkenny beer! My husband has had the hardest time finding this beer. We are from CA and last time he had this beer was is Ireland and New Zealand. We will definitely be coming out again. I can't remember who our bartender was on 3-13-18 around 10-12pm but he was awesome. Thanks bud!

Awesome place and atmosphere! Love the Irish music and overall feel. Nice aet up whether to kick back and have some drinks or even watch a game. The food was excellent and the service was gracious and hospitable!
A great Irish pub and grille on the west side.

My mother and I have been searching for good fish to have during Lent.  We noticed Tim Finnegan's going in several months ago but had yet to try it.  We checked online and then called to see if they had a good beer battered fish.  The gentleman we spoke to assured us they did and we decided to give it a try.  They did not disappoint.  In addition to the phenomenal service we received the fish was just as impressive!  If I were to make any suggestion it would be to try to keep the fish separate from the chips as it made them a little soggy but still very good.  We wanted to try a dessert but were too full and took a Bailey's bread pudding to go.  Even though it was taken to go it was great.  I can only imagine how good it would have been had we eaten it there.  Fellow Catholics look no further for great fish not just during Lent but anytime!
Although the presentation was sorta big-city-ish, I made a happy plate out of the corned beef and cabbage. Damn good stuff.  The house brew was tasty too. Next time shepherds pie!

Great wings!!! When we walked in I thought I might have made a mistake because nobody was there. It turned out to be because we were so early (11:10am). Josh turned out to be a very good waiter. He made recommendations and was attentive and when he said he really likes the wings, he was right - really good. I also had the Shepard's pie that was well done, potatoes creamy and content not overcooked.

Atmosphere was dark like every Irish place I have been in. Big bar fully stocked. And as it got to be lunch time the place filled up.

Not cheap lunch but reasonably priced and they have regular specials.
Monday is Half price hamburgers. These Burgers are gourmet and only cost $5.00. It is a great deal!! You can get a pint of Carlsberg for $3.00 I love the Irish Pub music.

I got some burgers from here via uber eats. I got the peppercorn burger. It was so good. My boyfriend got the bacon onion burger and he loved it. Fries were yummy. I'm gonna be going here from now on when I want a burger.

I am taking a star away sadly :( 

We went in this past Monday. I order my usual, a Stella. I am told they no longer have that on tap and wasnt offered a bottle, so I am not sure if they carry it anymore.  :( This makes kiki a sad lady. 

We were starving so we started with an app. We waited over 20-30 minutes for our app to come out. The place wasnt busy at all and there were multiple waitresses. We actually had forgotten we ordered the app when it did finally come out. 

It took another 20 minutes for our order to come out. Not sure what was going on there. 

The food was just as fantastic as always!
Liked everything about this place, French fries are freshly cut and worth the trip
I'll have to get back to you on this one... I'm a fk'n regular here so obviously I love it.

I just went here last night for dinner for the 1st time in 3 years. The food and service used to be good from what I can remember but that definitely wasn't the case last night. There were a few people sitting at the bar but the restaurant itself was pretty empty. The sign said "seat yourself" when we walked in so that's what we did. It took a good 15 minutes for our server to even acknowledge us and she was definitely not on top of her game. We ordered a couple of beers and those took another 15 minutes. She came back a while later to take our order. We ordered an appetizer, 2 entrees, a kids meal, and 2 more beers. It took over 20 minutes for our pretzel basket to come out and she forgot about our beers. My husband walked up to the bar at which point our server came over and blamed the bartender for not pouring our beers in a timely manner. Our dinners came about 10 minutes after the appetizer. I ordered the Killarney chicken based on our servers suggestion. It was a chicken breast smothered in cheese and a garlic sauce with Irish bacon on top. The bacon on top looked like it wasn't cooked all the way through and I couldn't bring myself to eat it. I took a couple bites of the chicken and at first it was moist but the more I started eating I realized the other 1/2 of the chicken breast was super dry and really over cooked. I wanted to say something to our server but we had already been there for 2 hours and I just wanted to get out of there. We will definitely not be back.

Comfortable atmosphere. I love restaurants with booths. We sit at a table 6 nights a week and love the intimacy of a booth while still being a part of the environment.
Lots of available parking, but you may have to hike a bit. The second thing I love about a restaurant.
The service. Pleasant , but busy.
The food. Competent, but I had pan seared cod that was smothered with chorizo gravy. Does every entree in Phoenix have to contain chorizo, hatch chilies or chipotle anything? I would order it again with the gravy on the side or hold it.

Fecking Great.    

Update:

Went for lunch:   This time I thought the corned beef taquitos even  better than last, curry chips tad saltier.  Still loving the appetizers and the cider.  This time had the  cottage pie,  it's  really nothing to write home about, specially if you are from the region and your parent's wouldn't appreciate you seeing other cottage pies;)    Spend the extra on the sheperds  it's really much better.   This was ok , really really nothing special and the heat could have been better.   Service  is good, but pedestrian , the last time I had no time pressure, this time I did.     We're sitting at 3.5 - 3.75 now with the round up till 4. Still  I'll return
 

Original Review:
 First thanks to Julie P for pointing out that this place exists. That it's within stumbling distance of the house ( think prolonged zombie stumble over an hour  versus a quick trip and recover)  is even better. 
Cider on tap is Strongbow and you get it in a real pint., Yay.  Sadly that's all they have and there's no bottled ones to try ,  Strongbow is  the Bud of UK ciders and while it's way better than no cider or what passes for beer here it's not that hard to stock more of a common drink for a themed bar. 

Onto the Food  (I'll get to it as a venue some other time)  
Appetizers.  Curry and chips was exactly what it should have been  and a generation of Irish and UK kids have  grown up with this for lunch  at the local chip shop.   
 
The  corned beef and cabbage taquitos  I think  are moving up to be our #1 appetizer that's not a hot wing. Taste of these  and the hot mustart / tomatillo salsa on the base compliment each other nicely. Not heavy on the fat and delightfully  crunchy.  For once an Irish restaurant trying to do something other than name US staples with cute regional names. 

Main: Salad   and the sheperd's pie. Let's not get into the salad it's a waste of time reviewing vegetables.  The pie is pretty good and none of the flavours overwhelm each other. Not sure the champ ( mashed potatos ) atop them live up to what lies below but it's more a personal texture issue than it spoiled the overall dish.  

Bread and Butter pudding is really good but please if you have any trouble sleeping after reading nutrition sheets as to the fat and carb content of your meal DON'T just  eat it and run round the  block four times before getting back in the car. 

Oddity?    parsley flakes on all the plates to make it green , please just buy green speckled plates , it's classier:D  At the end got a coupon for 25% off the next bill which I will certainly take them up on. It's as good  for food as any of the valley's Irish bars ( better imho)  but have to get back on pub quiz night  to really know.

Were in too early to hear the band but you can look at the pa, the space and  know it's going to sound  bad ( place looks like standing wave city)  with anything electric and full drum set.     The jukebox played "i'm too sexy " by Right said fred  WTF that really  messed up the ambience.Country bars don't have NIN on the box after all.

I had the best night out here last night.  We were welcomed with live music.  A man named AJ was playing with a friend and it was really good! The two of them played a great mix of music, from R&B to alternative rock. It wasn't overwhelming, like bar bands can be.  The waitress says AJ has played there for a while.

We ordered our beers and an appetizer- the garlic chips.  They were yummy seasoned fries with an excellent garlic aioli.  The garlic aioli was like a creamier version of the garlic sauce you get with your pita at a good Arabic restaurant. I I couldn't get enough of it.  My boyfriend kept telling me to slow down, but he was stealing big globs of the stuff in his fries (that thief!). 

For dinner, I had the Bacon Onion Jalapeño flatbread and a side of coleslaw.  The flatbread was great! The coleslaw wasn't super flavorful, but it was fresh and cooled my mouth down perfectly after consuming all those jalapeños.  

I highly recommend this place.

This is a great pub. First, the remodel on the inside is amazing. For what was once a pizza place you would never know. Great bar, wood work and decorations. We went for lunch on a Saturday. There were quite a few people but not overly crowded. Our server Theresa was excellent. She greeted us when we walked in and got our drinks. She recommended the cod slider appetizer and it was good. The breading wasn't too heavy or greasy. Very tasty. I had the lunch size Shepard's pie. Huge portion for lunch!! Very good flavor and again nit greasy. You can tell when things are homemade and it was. Hubby had a chicken dish with bacon, can't remember the name. He Gabe it a thumbs up. Overall, great service good food and a nice atmosphere. I'll go back when I'm on that side of town.

The service is phenomenal! My boyfriends Mom and Grandma love going there for the food and live entertainment. The crowd is younger and yet the staff makes them feel so comfortable. Treats them like queens. Special shout out to Alex and Dave.

Horrible! Food and drinks over priced...food was terrible! Only reason we drove all the way over here was to hear a band....they sent them home after 1 hr. Avoid at all cost! Bathroom was dirty with paper all over the stall floor, toilet seat covers laying off to the side...gross. Only 2 tables had people when we got here so don't understand why they couldn't clean them, I've seen dive bars with cleaner bathrooms. Employees not very friendly...no smiles at all.

Don't let the outside fool you, this place is legit. 

Nice selection of beers on tap (even Kilkenny, are you kidding me!!). 

Pretty good sheppards pie, great curry sauce, awesome decor. Practically felt like I was in ireland. 

I'll definitely be back sometime.
Excellent Pub Restaurant!! Great food, clean nice bar & atmosphere. Friendly bartender & staff.

So, we came here on a whim looking for bar food.  Boy did we find it.  The food that comes out of the kitchen is top notch and could certainly hold a candle to any other place in the city. I had the fish and chips, and was just blown away.  Sorry, but I ate it too fast to get a picture in...

The atmosphere is a cross between Cheers and the Tilted Kilt, and our server Dan was about as nice and helpful as he could be.
We tried the new location in Glendale. Good service, delicious food and reasonable happy hour prices. Love this place.

I have only been here a couple of times but this is totally my kind of place. Good drink prices $3 Carlsbergs, I have only had the fish and chips to eat and it was awesome. As far as Irish bars go, this one has good decor and detail. Now that its the only Official US Soccer bar in Arizona, I am going to spend a lot more time there come World Cup time.

Usually like this place, BUT the St.Patricks day party was a 10$ cover, for the same Irish band they have all the time. To stand and beg for a drink. When I get the drink, it's wrong and costs double what it normally costs... And it's in a cheap  plastic cup.

We found this restaurant using UberEATS & man are we happy we did! The philly fries are filling, the bacon garlic aioli burger yum! One of our guests had the cod sliders & couldn't get enough. Bread pudding was good. Overall we decided that next time we will make it out there to dine because the food was worthy.

Really disappointed. I was excited as heck to see this place so close by, and after reading through the menu, I couldn't wait to go.  I miss a good fry-up for breakfast, so I knew I had to give that a try. 

Whatever was done to those rashers is known only by the chef and God. It was clear they were not fried, and they had a greyish, mottled look of a meat that had been boiled or steamed. The black pudding had good flavor but was so incredibly overcooked and dry, it could have been packaged and sold by Jack Links.  The best thing on the plate was the wholemeal soda bread. It was crusty and hearty and I reckon would taste great with some soup or with a load of good butter. Our table also had a burger and some chicken tenders. The feedback on the burger was, "The bun was nice."  About half of the chicken went unfinished. 

Very steep price point for some horribly abused rashers and a "nice" burger bun. We won't be going back.
Really good fish & chips, and had two different portions you could choose. Would definitely come back again. One side was restaurant style and the other was a pub, so you could choose either.

First time at the new location. I came here to see Jason Devore play and the place was so packed I immediately regretted driving out here from Mesa. I can't blame that on the business though, Jason is just very popular. This place is miniscule compared to their last location, with much fewer beers on tap, then again, they just opened. The first time I opened a tab I got two kiltlifters (they only had bottles) and it came out to $13 and some change, which I thought was rather steep. I then ordered a third beer and it was $4 and some change. When I ordered a fourth, it was a little over $6. Idk if they have kiltlifter in their POS system twice (maybe there is both draft and bottle in the computer) but I was rather annoyed that the price kept changing. Not to mention the only place a 12 oz. bottle of kiltlifter should cost more than $6 is at a ball game or a large concert venue. Maybe they'll work out the kinks, but either way I don't feel inclined to return.

Btw, the door guy was probably one of the most interesting people I ever met. I spent most of the time on the patio talking to him since the place was so vastly over capacity. That bouncer deserves 5 stars himself.

Everything was fresh and delish!Great beer selection too.We had the Crisp cod sliders and corned beef and cabbage taquitos  for appetizers and couldnt wait for the entrees.
We got the fried Fish and chips,Baked cod ,mussels stew it was all delicious.we shared a bread pudding and fought for the last piece.
We came here with a group of 7 for my husbands birthday. Everyone loved their food, fun drinks, fun service, great atmosphere. The fish and chips are top notch!

Taking my Irish partner out to the pub should be a gesture of pure love. Finding an authentic pub near home should be a joy of epic proportions. Our visit to Tim Finnegans was disappointing. We seem to have difficulty getting attention in places we visit. Here again was a place we had to seat ourselves, get our own menu's, help ourself to silverware all while the place wasn't busy. We sat and when we did get a server she was incompetent. We tried to order food and drinks, but she left the table before we could finish.  We  got our drinks delivered by another server and asked for the appetizer from her. Then we just sat and watched the game on the screen. We watched our original girl take two other tables orders. Out came the appetizer and when it was completely gone, she came over to take our dinner order. 
The food: The chips and and curry appetizer was quite tasty, the curry sauce should be thicker to coat the chips more, and it could add some spice, but I thought it was a very novel item. The signature Lamb Shepherd's pie was very disappointing. You can substitute the L with an Sp and drop the silent B and get a better description of it's content. Hormel would be proud. The champ potatoes on top would be better replaced with pastry. My partner's corned beef and cabbage was decent. However the Corned beef was cut in narrow slivers and the meat was bloated with water. On the other hand the cabbage and parsley was very good. The potatoes were the same as atop the pie, they stood up better on a plate. We ordered the bread pudding and thought that the exterior was fabulous, the interior a bit too slimy and the whiskey/bourbon sauce, lacking in flavor or sweetness with a consistency that unnerved. I do not want to use an unsavory term for the consistency of that sauce, but it needs much more sweetening regardless. Take the sauce from Rula Bula and put it on the bread and you'd be much happier indeed! Over all the decor is nice, the place could have a good ambiance especially if they were playing Irish music, they weren't. It was some modern rock station. The check came before the dessert was gone and, well I guess we were done. 
Sigh. This really could have been a better experience.
We love to come in on Mondays for the $5 burgers....Sort of a long wait, every time. But...$5 burgers, of course you'll wait...lol:)

We went here about a month ago for drinks and a late snack. We were hoping to hear the live music that was listed on their facebook page but either the band didn't show up or it was a really short set. We showed up about an hour after it was scheduled to start. Anyway, our main reason for going was to get my husband a pint of his favorite beer, Kilkenny. We sat at the bar and the bartender poured him a pint but it didn't look right. We were trying to figure out if it was right or not when another bartender walked by and saw the beer, commented that it didn't look right, and got him a new (perfect!) one. We ordered a few apps and they were okay- pretty much what you expect to get at a bar. Overall, we'll try this place again and hopefully try their dinner lineup!

My husband and I love this place and couldn't go as often as we liked because it was a little far for us to drop in regularly - sorry it closed near Metro Centre but are so excited that it is opening close to our house 59th and Bell this month.  We have been checking every couple of days just waiting for it to open.  SO EXCITED!!!!

The food was ok,  Cod in mashed potatoes, shepherds pie and Guinness was delicious. The service is great... BUT The live music... Omg. Please bring people who know how to sing. It felt Like super drunk karaoke. Whoever set the sound system, must look for another job. The treble was extremely high and it was so loud that we couldn't even hear the waitress, that a the first time I'm going out of a restaurant and I can't hear in one of my ears.. 

Owner: if you want your restaurant to succeed, hire people who know their job !

This is a fun Irish pub. It's nice and dark inside to get you out of the AZ heat, and a good place to grab a pint and a filling meal. I often crave a bit-o-Tim Finnegan's after a long work day. They have some trivia and karaoke nights that get a bit noisy, but I always have a good time there. I love the burgers, corned beef and cabbage taquitos, and they have some good specials/happy hour options on each night of the week.

My husband and I were regulars here when they were located by Metrocenter. We were bummed out when they abruptly closed last summer. We were thrilled yesterday to see it pop up on Yelp under Fresh and New. Needless to say, that where we ate last night. LOVE the the location! They kept the charm of the prior location while updating it it with with some new decor and cool lighting. This place was popping last night! The restaurant was full and the vibe was good. The food was exactly as before which is what we were hoping for. We had the wings, which are our favorite, the potato skins, and shared the Killarney chicken. The chicken tastes home made and the green beans are cooked perfectly-not mushy, perfect with a little bite left in them. Glad to have this spot back, we will be back!

Was on Yelp looking up local bars while on my trip to Phoenix , was really happy I stumbled across this place . They had the Brazil Vs Ecuador game and stayed for the whole game . The drinks here are amazing had a couple of Irish Mudslides , Irish car bombs , and the mint chip shots as well . I didn't get a chance to order an entree but did have an appetizer and it was delicious . If you're visiting and happen to be near here I definitely recommend this place , didn't get the bartenders name but the customer service was great . This place gets 2 thumbs up .

Foodies: get over there for the Monday night burger special and wash it down with $3 Carlsberg's every day. On second thought, keep your distance - I love this place and want to keep it for myself! If you're a fan of spectacular, fresh, authentic Irish fare, have a strong liver, and want a cozy, inviting place to relax, come buy me a beer. At $3, you can afford it!

Well.. I've  been bugging my family  to go for authentic  Iris food.
What a BIG disappointment. .. Authentic Irish hmm I  don't think so.  I had the corned beef and cabbage 
The corned beef tasted like canned.  The cabbage was stir fry and very  greasy.    Not impressed

In Phoenix on business, my London-born wife and I looked on Yelp for a decent English or Irish pub. Tim Finnegan's topped the list, so we decided to check it out. When we arrived, live music was playing and the place was packed. We were lucky enough to find an open table with a great view of the Irish musician. I got the Reuben and she got the large fish and chips. My sandwich was delicious, and the chips (fries to us Yanks) were amazing. Her fish was done perfectly, and the portion was enormous - enough for both of us, truth be told. Washed it down with an expertly poured Guinness to cap a perfect evening. Our waitress was a lovely lass and more than gracious, if anything too apologetic for the slight delay in taking our order. We were in no hurry to leave and could see that she had her hands full. Overall it was a terrific experience, and we'll definitely be back next time we're in the area.

Okay, first time at this new location. Made the mistake of going on St. Pat's Day. $15 each cover just to get in!!!! My husband had the corned beef and cabbage, and I had a rueben. Our waitress was slow and forgetful. My fries were stone cold but she took forever to come back around to us, so I just let it go. No regular beers today, so we had to have a specialty beer. Each of them were $8. We will not return to them on St. Patrick's Day. We are seniors and this was way too expensive for us. Almost $100!!! Wasn't worth it at all.  Very disappointed, especially since we are truly Irish.

What better place for a girls night out than an Irish pub? We sat in a great booth across from the bar where we could all talk easily (even with the karaoke happening in the background). The service was a little slow, but I'm pretty sure there was only 1 (super awesome) server running his tail off. Who knew Sunday nights were so busy?! I'm me more thing about our server: a man across the bar offered to buy our table drinks and our server ran interference for us. I love a place that makes me feel protected/watched out for. 

Our drinks were made well. My sister order d a couple specialty cocktails: Paddy's Punch (sweet, fruity, a little amaretto) and some mint cookie drink (baileys, creme de menthe). My Moscow mule was yummy, as were the vodka sodas. 

We had to try the Corned Beef and Cabbage taquitos (it's fusion!!) because where else would you find that?! I didn't care for them, but that's more of a texture than taste thing (Potatoes inside of a taquitos???). My sis liked them. We also go the the Buffalo Chicken Wrap (good flavor, but weird lettuce inside that didn't seem to go together!) and the Southwestern Chicken Wrap (yum!). The fries were kind of old and squishy. I bet they are amazingly delicious when they are fresh. 

One last thing: the karaoke jockey was great. Very welcoming and entertaining (good voice too). The setup is strange though...you either sing from your seat or stand awkwardly next to the server station and bathrooms. Lucky for me, I've got a lot of practice in awkwardness! :)
Regardless if you DO or DO NOT like Irish food, I command you to eat here if you are in Phoenix. You will regret every minute should you disobey this order.
Great Irish Pub, from the moment you step through the door - quality food and drinks at affordable prices, excellent and attentive staff make you will fill right at home...even if you're not Irish.

Tried this place out recently, and have to say I am impressed. 

The first thing that I liked was the appearance of the place. Yes, it is part of a strip mall and adjacent to some oddball places, but as soon as you walk up, you can see that they stand out from their neighbors. The darkened wood paneling, the patio and the red entry doors leave little doubt that you're standing outside a pub. Once you step inside, you'll find subdued lighting, more dark wood paneling, cozy booths, plenty of bar seating and a definite pub vibe going on. You can only be so authentic in a place like Glendale and this is probably about as good as you're going to find anywhere. 

When we arrived, we seated ourselves (I guess how it works?) and were shortly brought menus and some water. I will say the water tasted like tap, and not in a good way, so I wouldn't recommend it as your only beverage. Fortunately neither of us went that route, and our other beverages were fine. I can't fault them for this, tap water is nasty in Phoenix no matter where you go, but just an FYI, it is definitely from the tap.

For appetizers, we sampled both the pub wings and the spinach dip. The dip came out first, followed shortly by the wings, and both were pretty good. The pita chips that came with the spinach dip are an interesting departure from what I've come to expect when order this dish elsewhere, but it wasn't bad. It might have been better if they were slightly less baked/fried, because a few times, the taste of the browned pita was overpowering the dip. Likewise, because they're so greasy from the baking/frying, the spinach dip actually struggles to stay on the pita unless you scoop up a massive helping. If you've ever tried to dip heavily buttered or oily pretzels into some cheese dip and noticed that none of it adhered, that's the same exact thing. Sure, you can work around it, but you shouldn't have to get creative to get dip on the chip. I'd still order it again, but just putting this out there as constructive feedback that I think would improve the dish. 

As for the wings, which we ordered mild, they were fantastic. The sauce tasted absolutely identical to something I've had at small, family owned pizza chain here in town, to the point where even my dining companion said the exact same thing, unprompted. Mind you, this isn't a criticism, because I love the flavor, it was more a pleasant surprise. I wish I knew where they bought the stuff, or where they got this recipe. Aside from the sauce, the wings were perfectly cooked and actually much better (and larger) than what I'm used to at the aforementioned 'other place'. Without a doubt, I will be ordering those again on my next visit. 

For an entree, we both tried the turkey club, and they were delicious. In my view, just the right amount of meat, and the flavor was spot on. The fries that come with the sandwich were not my thing, but I had so much other food, it really didn't matter. I'm not a big fan of fries in the first place, so again, I can't hold that against them. I understand you can swap it out for something else, but looking at the menu, I'm not sure what the something else would be. It would be nice if this was clearly broken out somewhere. 

Bonus points, this place does not appear to have any type of children's menu. Thank God! I can't stand being surrounded by oblivious, inconsiderate breeders who think a restaurant (and especially a bar) should double as a day care center, so that was a welcome change of pace, and yet another reason to go back.
